name: Hubbard Park
reviews: Magical winter wonderland in Montpelier, VT. Be sure to stop by if you ever visit Vermont. We were in awe at all the beauty of this fabulous forest covered in snow. Definitely recommend a visit to this place.
Beautiful trails lead from downtown to historic towers to deserted forests, there is a trail for every ability level, and friendly knowledgeable locals with their great dogs
Love walking the different trails watch out for the snakes love the wild life and so close to town
Great park. Plenty of space for a game, a walk, or even just a place to get peace and quiet. Some days have more dogs than others. As long as I've been in town I haven't seen any litter in this park.
Hazel and I love Hubbard Park! We've been walking here for years. Enjoyed the jack o lantern filled path last week.

name: Vermont State House
reviews: This is one of the coolest places I have ever been to. Visiting from Canada, the tour was excellent. Learnt a lot about the history of the Legislature. Our tour guide was excellent and he was really funny too. He really cracked us up and made the tour interesting. This is one of the places that if I visit Vermont again, I will surely stop by again.

Magnificent capitol, both from the outside and inside. It's quite picture-worthy, especially at night when the building is lit nicely.

The free guided tour was very informative. Definitely join one if you are visiting. I was quite surprised to learn that the legislature only meets for about four months in a year, during the first quarter! We were able to visit the legislative halls since there were no on-going sessions. At the end of the tour, visitors can stay and head to the cafeteria for food and drinks. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful, especially the ladies at the gift shop.

If you don't have time for the tour, you can check out the virtual tour on their website.
Visited here during a weekday, and the entrance was free! We were given audio devices and maps the explore the whole House. Beautiful architecture!
Quintessential building with history lessons in every step. Well worth the visit.

I loved visiting the Vermont State House! When I arrived on Saturday, I wasn't expecting to be able to go inside or take a tour, but I'm glad they were open. The docent was outstanding and the building, beautiful! I recommend stopping if you have free time.

name: Vermont Historical Society Museum
reviews: Nice small museum. It will be great to see that even this museum dosen't charge any visitor fee like other Museums in US.

We got in for free during an event day offering free admission which was really great for us. We travel full time so paying for tons of museums and outings can add up. It’s a small museum but decently done. I do wonder if there could be a little more local vermont history or more detailed history Added around. Some was more broad and general stuff that most anyone would know. Sure sheep and cows and such were used for farming. But I would have liked a little more in depth history on things and how things were done in vermont compared to other states. How roads were carved and built in and through/around the mountains. History of covered bridges, maple farms, quarries etc. but I also admit I was a bit rushed on a time crunch before closing so it is possible I rushed pass some of these things without realizing. 

Overall it was a nice museum and laid out in a horseshoe so it was easy to walk through. But this is a huge building. It would be nice to have more floors of history to explore. Looking at the pricing it seems fairly priced for what is here. $7 an adult, $5 kids and seniors and under 6 free, $20 for families. 

I also bought some nice postcards in the giftshop.

Small, but really well done museum describing Vermont history from the time of early human settlement to the present day.  I found the section on colonial and early American history especially interesting, especially given the complicated and often strained relationship that Vermonters have had with New York, New Hampshire, and the Crown.  Takes about an hour to go through and it is well worth the time and money.
Nice visit to add along with a tour of the state house.

Thoughtful and interesting historical displays.   Lots of historical artifacts arranged in relevant groups to illustrate Vermont's rich heritage: colonial settlers, land disputes between Grant's and Yorkers, native American heritage, wars,  industrialization,  railroads, everyday life and art... and much more.  Wish we left enough time to visit more than just the first floor.

name: North Branch Nature Center
reviews:
Went to a foraging class and it was AWESOME!!! We're going to take the mushroom one too and keep looking for other events. It's about 40 mins from us but it was such a great day it's worth the drive!

Informative, exciting, fun, kind, funny! Just great staff and a GREAT class!
Great trails for cross country skiing!

We were here for the Express purpose of swimming in one of the swimming holes.  This is such a beautiful place. Swimming was hard because getting into the water was difficult for me. No sand beach areas.  And for the record clothing was optional, found that out accidentally but who cares
We love NBNC! Great place for bird watching, hiking and enjoying nature. Events are amazing!
Very knowledgeable, friendly staff.  Extensive trail system that crosses the Winooski River, with plenty of spots to take s dip to cool off.

name: North Branch Vineyards
address: 82 Trillium Hill Rd, Montpelier, VT 05602, USA
reviews: Great experience/introduction to Vermont wines. You're missing out if you don't stop!

We had a great time today visiting this winery at the owners home. We tried a superb variety of white and red wines. The owner was very interesting and  knowledgeable  on wine making.  He introduced us to some tasty hard apple cider with a delicious wine jelly on crackers.

Our experience here was incredible! A small, off-road adventure just a few miles from downtown Montpelier led us to one of the best wine tastings we’ve had in New England. The owner gave impeccable descriptions of his wine and took such pride in the making of it. It’s rare to find people who have followed their true passion and I can say this owner certainly has! As Californians we have high expectations for wine tasting and this winery met all of them. If you’re even passing through Montpelier it is worth a stop!

Not only is the wine and cider awesome, but the owner is extremely informational about winemaking. He also has a very interesting background. This winery is definitely worth the trip! Also, don't be put off by the fact that it's run out of a house :-)

We visited John at North Branch for a wine-tasting on a Friday afternoon and he spent almost an hour talking to us about his wines and vineyards, and then gave us a detailed tour through his wine-making operation. It was a very enjoyable and informative experience, and the wine is absolutely phenomenal.

name: Fresh Tracks Farm Vineyard & Winery
reviews: I really enjoyed this place. The building is beautiful. Went and had a wine tasting, get six pours and a complimentary wine glass. I had the sweet flight tasting and it was great. I think my favorites were the maple wine and the mapple wine. We also ordered cheese and crackers and it did not disappoint. They also allowed us to bring in our outside food and that was really nice of them.
Love this winery! Jenny is fantastic and full of positive energy! The wines were excellent and the location is beautiful. Thank you for being a HH!

One of our favorite vineyards!  The staff is always friendly and the wine is awesome.  Highly recommend visiting.  On one of our initial visits we got to meet Arthur.  As dog lovers, it made our visit that much more special.
Very friendly staff and great price! We left with three bottles and would definitely come back. Good wine and beautiful place.
Beautiful winery and tasting room with friendly, helpful staff. A pretty good selection of reds and we enjoyed them enough to bring a few back to Delaware with us.

name: Hope Cemetery
reviews: Wonderful experience! Beautiful gravestones with astonishing details. Also several beautiful epitaphs and tributes. Definitely worth spending the afternoon, or even just driving through for a quick look. Highly recommend it!
Amazing place to wander around and check out all the intricate and creative gravestones
Beautiful monuments. A true showcase of talented artists.
Beautiful as always.

Historical site in Central Vermont. Clean, safe and well maintained.
Learning about Barre history has never been so easy.
Go Visit!

name: Vermont Granite Museum
address: 7 Jones Brothers Way, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews: The Vermont Granite Museum is a cute little gem in Barre City. It was a good venue (sound was a bit echo-y) for our small conference. The venue does an excellent job highlighting the importance of granite to Vermont.
Amazing display of the granite industry.. And the folks that work there.. Super knowledgeable and helpful

We were greeted by a very nice man that asked us some questions relating to the history of granite in Barre, he then explained the .most practical way to view the museum.  Great displays of how the granite industry was made in Barre VT.  Lots of displays, pohotos and old news articles.

This is an extremely cool place if you are looking to see the history of the granite industry in the Barre area. This gives full scope look at the the industry back in the early days to present day including (if you time it right) being able to watch actual sculptures at work
Great place to get history of Vermonts granite mining...

name: North Branch River Park
reviews: Nice trails by the river. Gets muddy especially in spring.
Fun to run the dog out here

name: Wrightsville Beach Recreation Area
reviews:
For a second year in a row, my family had visited this amazing place to swim and play at the beach and gave left with very fond memories! 

CLEAN! SERINE! DAY TRIP DREAM!

Parking is abundant and the gravel roads are very smooth.  It's not a long walk to the service booth or activities. 

Bring your charcoal and grill a lunch under the trees but bring a trash bag for your mess. Swimming and frisbee golf had a reasonable fee but it's obvious the money goes right back into maintaining the grounds! 

 The bathrooms are pretty plain with a concrete floor and some old but well maintained bathroom fixtures. If you need modern accommodations, the restrooms may leave you dissatisfied but we found them clean and well maintained. Some funding toward bringing this area will lock in the five star rating. 

Thank you to the people and organizations that maintain this area so well; I'm looking forward to many more trips here and feel this place has set the bar high as a standard other places to model.
Has bathrooms and a small snack shack for the little ones.  Quiet and peaceful
Very well up kept and clean great for a day at the beach and boat rentals.
Clean beach  nice place
Nice little beach. You can rent Kayaks oder Canoes. Has changing rooms and toilets.

name: Cabot Farmers' Store - Waterbury
address: 2657 Waterbury Stowe Rd, Waterbury, VT 05676, USA
reviews: This is a can't miss location for great food, incredible cheese tasting, other food tasting, great education, craft beer and wine and just all-around fun. the big Epiphany for us was how many of the Cabot cheeses, the aged cheeses, are lactose-free. Westaff did a great job educating usabout cheese differences, the process for making cheese and what each member of the family could eat without having to worry. It's great to be supporting this co-op of family farms and the great staff here. Looks like a specialty grocery store (and it is) but it's also a fabulous tourist stop. Come in and delight the entire family!

Very friendly and inviting, the owners treat you like family, Free tasting of all the cheese's they sell as well as most spreads and dips, Their selection of syrups and Honey had a wide variety of tastes and uses. There also is a very Large selection of higher end specialty items. A very nice visit Recommend to all.

This is a great place to stop and try the best cheese in Vermont. Sample almost all of their cheeses, plus some dips. Great variety of other items in the store, including a nice selection of wine and local beer, as well as other tasty treats.

How can you go wrong with all the cheese?!? Taste them. Buy them. Eat them. Repeat. Cabot makes the best and that's that. My 3lb block of cheddar will be my longest relationship, haha! 

Go to Cabot!

Love this store! Love cheese!!! Didn't want to go all the way to the factory so this was an awesome consultation! I spent way all of my spending money on the food! So many choices of cheese, dips, crackers, maple products and Vermont-made items, I couldn't resist! Great staff too! Very helpful! And I appreciated the cleanliness especially around the samples.

name: Morse Farm Ski Touring Center
reviews:
Nice little gem that is pure Vermont! This is what CT is all about. Showcasing what sugar makers can do and providing a quality product.

Maple syrup is competitively priced against peers.
Great spot for tourists or locals. Get the meal deal with a pickle a donut sugar on snow and a hot beverage. Great place on a snowy day too. Downside is how popular it is because it’s very crowded.
Learn about how maple syrup is made from a very old family run business. Taste all the different grades of syrup.
Not just for leaf peepers and tourists! This place is visited by most locals as well! Try the orange Sunkist maple creamer float. Sounds weird but really good!
Great selection of vt products. Friendly and helpful.

name: Mount Mansfield State Forest
address: 175 Pleasant Valley Rd, Underhill, VT 05489, USA
reviews: Just make a quick drive up to the Notch, park and have a short little hike!  The drive up is entertaining in itself, go slow near the top and be courteous , it lets enjoy the scenery more!  The parking fills up quick though, but you can improvise park most anywhere it seems haha.

What a view! We decided to hike to the top, what a terrible yet rewarding idea. It was not easy, I had to lay down multiple times, but we made it and it was worth it. Riding down on the way back was also an excellent decisions. The staff is very friendly.

What an amazing hike. Highly recommend taking the laural trail first even though it's the most strenuous it's all worth it. Once you get to the top it's some of the best views in New England. The loop back down sunset ridge is breath taking and much easier

I loved my hike through and up Mount Mansfield. The paths are well laid out and maintained its a fairly gentle hike (sunset ridge) with only a few steep sections. Take your time and expect to spend around 5hours going up and down on this hike - much more rewarding than taking the gondola up!
The views we're gorgeous! We hiked the long trail south to the chin and back down. That route was definitely rough on the body. There are shorter trails and a gondola to take you to the top as well.

name: Seyon Lodge State Park
address: 2967 Seyon Pond Rd, Groton, VT 05046, USA
reviews: Cozy lodge with amazing food and helpful staff. Absolutely worth the trip.
A wonderful place for many activities, terrific staff, lovely food, all in all  venue greater than the sum of it's parts.
My cousin got married here...it was such a beautiful setting for a wedding!
Great food, friendly service and cozy accommodations. Will definitely be coming back.
Beautiful spot

name: Morse Farm Maple Sugarworks
reviews: Great place. It was my first stop in Vermont. Easy to get to and great scenery. Do yourself a favor and walk the grounds and read about the history. I picked up a few gifts for the family. It goes without saying the syrup is a must. Enjoyed the different varieties but #4 was my favorite.
Some of the best maple syrup products I’ve ever had. The maple ice cream is delicious! Fun and educational displays and videos too. Plus enjoy the spectacular view on the back patio.
Great destination for Maple products and something to do.  They also carry beef, hamburger, steak, and pork.  As well great knickknacks for gifts!

Love that place...Best ice cream cone. Very friendly staff. One of Morse family lady ensured that we see the maple making video and she took us in a video room. It's really a best place to enjoy ice cream cone with a lovely mountain views.
Perfect stop to experience the Vermont maple tradition. Ice cream was excellent.

name: Groton State Forest
reviews:
So many beautiful views. 
Great trail systems

A gem of the New England outdoors. I came up here after Labor Day to enjoy some pre-season foliage, weather was perfect for mid September. Very few hikers on the trails! My hiking loop was from New Discovery to Groton Lake and back. Trails aren't super well marked at the trail crossings.

Spruce Mountain is a great afternoon of hiking, 2.2 miles up to a beautiful view at the top is always worth it. The trail is rocky but kept in check, wear some heavy boots. A few landmarks along the way include caves, swamps and streams and a very wild and free feeling at the top of the firetower. Great way to spend an afternoon and good for all ages.

Groton State Forest, what a great place to go and commune with nature again.many campsites available where you can go and spend a couple nights either in a tent or small RVs. Nature lovers are going to love this arium many places to go lots of animals small lakes. Many small areas to go kayaking and canoeing.
One of my favorite places to be. Quiet, rural, serene. Whether visiting just for the day to hike and swim or staying for a week camping, this place is awesome!

name: Cold Hollow Cider Mill
address: 3600 Waterbury Stowe Rd, Waterbury Center, VT 05677, USA
reviews: What a unique and beautiful place! Fall is definitely the time to visit. It certainly gets you in the mood for fall 🍁🍁🍁🍁 I was impressed with how much there was to choose from! We bought delicious Vermont cheese, peanut butter cookies, maple syrup and jam. The doughnuts and cider were a delicious breakfast the following morning ❤️ I would highly recommend this place and make a future visit as well!

My husband and I visited here after snowmobiling with Snowmobile Vermont (amazing time!). Snowmobile Vermont gave us a coupon for a free apple cider donut so we decided to check it out. 

The store is absolutely beautiful anything Vermont related items you can think of they had it and the apple cider donut was one of the best I’ve ever tasted! 

I took away 2 stars because the cashing out experience was lacking. The woman that assisted us didn’t greet us at all or acknowledge us standing there waiting to be checked out. Finally we get called over and we’re cashing out (we purchased about 20 dollars worth of stuff). I showed her the coupons and she looked like wasn’t happy about seeing the coupon. She just took them scanned them and gave us our items. Customer service plays a big role in any business and I do feel that in this area it was inadequate.

Those apple cider donuts are just one of the many incredible things offered by this place. Food and baked goods are just so hearty and yes, fresh. We liked their coffee and sandwiches. The different Vermont goods offered are so delicious and tell a story. A must visit place and an experience

Cold Hollow Cider Mill is worth a visit for delicious apple cider and cider donuts. You can watch how the crushed apples are made into cider through a window for free. Cider (not hard cider) samples are also free and self-serve. Souvenirs and food products (e.g. maple, honey) are also sold here. Definitely a great shop for gifts. 

The cider donuts  was delicious, denser cake-like donut. Best enjoyed with some apple cider. 

My friend used a purchase of $25 voucher to get half a dozen donuts. We chose to just get 3 donuts, since we wouldn’t be able to finish it.

The store is a wonderful place to visit for cider, maple syrup, jam, and other lovely quintessentially Vermont products.  HOWEVER, and it is a big however, there is a working heating stove on the floor in the middle of the store, which was extremely hot the day I visited this past weekend.  The stove is sitting directly on the floor blasting heat with no screen, gate, or other protection for the customers.  

I had no idea the stove was even there when I was walking around the store with my toddler son.  He was not running or being disruptive and was never more than a few feet away from me.  We turned a corner and before I even noticed the stove on the floor, my son has walked a few steps and put his hand directly on the hot glass, which again was not blocked or protected by anything.  He immediately screamed and took his hand off the glass, but by then he had received second-degree burns on all of this little fingers.  He has suffered greatly this week and remains at risk of infection. 

Granted, we left the store very quickly to take him to an urgent care clinic, but no store employee approached us to see if he was ok.  I then called the store this past Monday to inform them of the accident and kindly request that they place a screen or some sort of gate in front of this extremely hot stove easily accessible by anyone walking through the store and at perfect child height.  I was told I would receive a call from the owner the next day, but have not yet received one. 

I remain shocked that this stove is left unprotected out in the open of a very family-oriented store and at the lack of care the staff and owners have showed us.  Needless to say, I won't be returning, and I urge visitors, especially with young children, to watch out for the stove.

name: Little River State Park
address: 3444 Little River Rd, Waterbury, VT 05676, USA
reviews: This campground is everything you could ever want in a state run park. It's gorgeous and heavily wooded, situated on the shores of the Waterbury Reservoir. Most sites have waterfront views and some even have water access. They sell firewood and ice (block and cubed). If you have exact change you can help yourself any time of day. Super friendly staff, very helpful. This is now my go to car camping park in Vermont.

Absolutely beautiful place to camp in the fall , I drove up here to celebrate my 30th birthday all by myself . All the sites have what I would call a great view , bathrooms in walking distance and the shower takes quarters , and the pressure and hot water both work great! Picnic table and fire pit on site , more private sites are available for anyone interested. I can't wait to try this place in the summer !

Little River was a fantastic camping place! You can buy firewood and ice from the site. Each camp site has it's own fire pit, many have a grate to make grilling or cooking over the fire easier. We were in spot 51 that had a really pretty view of the water but we were kinda close to neighbors on each side. Would definitely return to camp again. Theres so many trail hiking options as well.

Hiked only. The trail we were on was in good condition even though it was not blazed .  Drove around the campsites and made us want to camp again.  This place is pretty awesome, though around the rivers, it can get very buggy. Employees were very friendly. FYI, It does take awhile to get to this park from the main road even though it is only 3 miles off it, it’s mostly a dirt road.

Best state park. Best. Cabins are particularly nice, and each of the car camping spots feel private and wild, despite being numerous. The History Hike is a favorite, and the Stevenson Brook Trail has some really cool water and rocks. The springtime high water is pretty impressive as well, and makes for tough crossings where required and where no bridge is present.

name: Vermont Historical Society
reviews:
Small museum with limited exhibitions, affiliated with the Vermont Historical Museum in downtown Montpelier. If you visit that other museum first, they'll give you tickets for admission to this museum. Not sure if the same is true if you visit this one first.

The only exhibition during our visit was on the history of auto racing in Vermont, with cool vintage photos, memorabilia and artifacts on display. There is also a game that lets you virtually drive a race car in use during the early years. Our visit lasted half an hour.

VHS offers a wealth of historical and genealogical information, some of which is not available elsewhere. All staff were helpful and made us feel welcome. There is a small fee for non-members visiting  the section of the site which supports genealogical research. Other areas are free. Parking is on street at no cost. The building is handicap accessible.
Clean , friendly , great racecar exhibit.
Home to Vermont  history and a few great libraries
Wonderful historic collections and exhibits

name: Mad River Glen Cooperative
reviews: The greatest Vermont mountain you've never heard of. Incredible snow quality (all natural) with superb glades and plenty of moguls to keep you busy. I love that all trails converge at one base area and all lifts take you to the top. The single chairlift is also a plus - definitely a throwback. A humble, quaint mountain with serious terrain. I highly recommend.

I have previously rated this place. I've been coming here for 20 years. Shortly after I learned to ski. The ownership by co-op gives the mountain a down-home feel. Mad River Glen has continued to provide a haven of natural beauty and a variety of technical and enjoyable terrain for any skill level on skis.
Cannot say enough good things about Mad River Glen the terrain in great. And the environment in so original.
Perfect in every way. Love the vibe. Love the challenging terrain. The snow was perfect. It’s Vermont’s best kept secret. Don’t tell anyone! ;)
The best there is, the finest kind. It’s old school and perfect with lots of tight trails, squirrel paths, quick decision abound! This place is truly special for core skiers, enjoy

name: State Owned Historic Sites
address: National Life Building, 0001, Montpelier, VT 05620, USA

name: Waterbury Center State Park
address: 177 Reservoir Rd, Waterbury Center, VT 05677, USA
reviews: This is a very hard park to find.  Drive slowly along Rt 100 and you will see reservoir road and tucked back about 200 yards is the park entrance.  Great swimming and boating.  Amazing views.   There is a small fee to get in but it is very worth the money.

Amazing view!
It's free to get in! Not so easy to park, there's no parking lot.
There's a place to do barbecue with your friends with a beautiful view!
You can swim, the water is very clean and the park is very clean too.
It's pet friendly, you can bring your pet here!
If you go to Ben & Jerry's factory you have to come to this park, it's only 6 minutes from the factory.
Went Kayaking here and family had a blast! Dog friendly and even rented some paddle-boards from the little shop. Would definitely visit again.
Nice spot to go for a swim! You pay per person in the car to enter. There were quite a few people there for a Monday, maybe that's just what peak season is like.
This is as picturesque as it gets.  Beautiful setting, lawn, lake, kyaks ets.  Just glorious.

name: Bolton Valley Resort
address: 4302 Bolton Valley Access Rd, Richmond, VT 05477, USA
reviews: Skiing/ snowboarding on Monday was an awesome deal for us who have never skied before. We rented the equipment and lift tickets at a great price. I started out on a snowboard and then switched to 🎿 for only $5, so I was able to try both. Personal I had more fun on the snowboard, but thought the 🎿 would be easier for me because they are for most people. Only about 30 minutes from S. Burlington and was easy to find. Would love to try the trails when I get more experience under my belt, but still had fun learning how to 🎿 on my own...

My son had his wedding at The Ponds which is just down the hill a ways from the ski resort. One hundred+ of our wedding guests stayed at the Bolton Valley Inn on Fri and Sat nights. We had fun night skiing on Friday and had our Welcome Party at the Village Cafe. Everything was lovely, the food was great and the staff friendly. Nice Mountain for children and teens. Ski terrain is limited but there is something for everyone. Lots of green and light blue on the lower half of the mountain.

Bolton employees were extremely friendly and helpful.  My group arrived in an RV. We called Customer Services and they sent out one of the employees out to greet us. We were granted 'RockStar' parking considering it was temporary for the day. The skiing/snowboarding is most challenging in the glades.  The glade area closed at 3:30 so you have to make certain you have the plan and time to do it!  Highly recommend.  The view from the top is amazing!  Overlooking Lake Champlain and NY State was gorgeous.

This mountain is a little gem. I've been skiing the east for 40 years and somehow managed to miss this place. Probably because it is so close to Stowe. I will say it is worth taking a day off from the larger places to check out the sweet cruiser glades of Bolton. I would have given 5 stars if the staff were better. Everyone seems like they are doing you a favor by taking your money and the ski school almost killed my daughter's desire to ski, but other than that, I really liked the mountain.

Let's go, Chipmunks!

Expect 9 am crowd at ski school registration. Kids start as Chipmunk and are upgraded to Moose, Raccoon, and all the way Coyote. "Boats" is my girls' coach who is fun, attentive while challenging them in a safe environment. Bolton may not be the biggest or the most famous around, it is just the right one for family with young kids。

name: Ben & Jerry's Flavor Graveyard
address: 1281 Waterbury-Stowe Road, VT-100, Waterbury Village Historic District, VT 05676, USA
reviews:
Its a good experience for kids specially. Definitely you get some free ice cream at the end of the tour.
Cool views to how they make the cream we love so much. 
Definitely recommend the tour.
Very close to I-89.
This is such a cool idea! This is a graveyard of all the ice cream flavors that didn’t make it. They have some very unusual flavors and it is fun to just explore.
So much fun - see how the best ice cream is made!

It was so inspiring to see the flavors that have passed before our very eyes. It truly is a monument to great ice creams and to those who love it. Please pay all of your respects to these giants of ice cream history. Hope this helps!

My only problem was the snow (late March). The headstones made me laugh and I sent some photos to family for them to enjoy too. I appreciated the offering of spoons instead of flowers by one of them. 🤗

name: Allis State Park
address: 284 Allis State Park Rd, Randolph, VT 05060, USA
reviews: A Vermont State Park hidden gem! Come for a quick hike, beautiful views from the fire tower, a picnic, or if you need to host a gathering- rent the pavilion! There is camping onsite as well. The fire tower has a lookout guide inside so you can really get a great idea of what you're looking at!

The ranger and the park volunteer are superb in welcoming guest. The park is extremely clean and it is very quiet.  You can hear the trees blow in the wind and the comfort is the best I have experienced!  This State Park is really a must for anyone seeking to relax and enjoy!
great view from the firepower. 360 degree view of surrounding mountains. short hike. nice trails.
Love the 360 views from the fire tower.
Came for the fire tower - stayed for the horseshoes

name: Cabot Creamery Visitors Center
reviews:
I went with my grandson Kevin’s field trip to Cabot this morning.  I had a wonderful time and enjoyed the tour.  I tried several types of cheese and my favorite was Vermont Sharp.  
I bought a coffee cup and a T-Shirt from the gift shop.  The cashier was very friendly and asked if I needed the cup wrapped in bubble wrap which I did.  I would recommend this tour to anyone traveling through Cabot VT.

One of the iconic places to visit while in Vermont. You can't tour the factory anymore due to FDA regulations. They have an abundant amount of cheese flavors you can sample. These also have a good amount of other things to try from other farms like syrup, peanut butter, pudding, etc. It's located in a very small and quaint town which is also nice.
I love Cabot. It is a great little town in the Vermont country side. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. The tours are fun and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming!

Awesome selection of cheddars to sample, short video of the company story, no tour but there’s a lookout window to the plant. Located in a beautiful village. Not busy when we came so they let us sample some of the preserve pairings. Everything was delicious.

Very nice, but small visitors center.  Eat as many samples as you like!  Unfortunately, the creamery does not give tours anymore due to federal health regulations, but the do show a nice video and hold a short question and answer session afterwards.  The staff was friendly and very proud of their products.  Plan on spending 1 to 2 hours here.

name: Boulder Beach State Park
address: 2278 Boulder Beach Rd, Groton, VT 05046, USA
reviews: Had a lot fun today with the grand kids

Super nice sandy beach with a good grassy area, play structures. The water and the land were both clean. There's a snack bar there (candy, ice cream bars, microwave burritos etc - nothing particularly high quality, but not over priced either), changing rooms, and flush toilets. There's even free sunscreen at the snack bar
Beautiful view, clear water, sandy beach.

Boulder Beach is a great place to spend a day with your family. We have been many times. Last week we went and once again remembered just how lovely it is. The view, the concession stand, the changing rooms, and of course the lake itself, all great pieces of the whole picture.
Slightly inconvenient boat launch, but nice place to paddle with classic lake houses all around the shore. Playground and picnic areas as well.

name: Elmore State Park
reviews:
We arrived in the rain for a tent camp, and were delighted to discover they had Lean-tos available for that night! The attendant upgraded our accommodation without hesitation, and was helpful and courteous.

The lean-to was sturdy, spacious, clean and dry, with a front porch overhang. It was a tad cold in the morning, but it was October!. The view from our site was beautiful, and the campground wasn't busy, so we had a lot of undisturbed quiet time.

The bathrooms were clean, though a little run-down  and outdated. The were electric lights inside, some plug outlets, and one coin-operated shower.

We bought 2 bundles of firewood, but couldn't use the wheelbarrow provided to take them back to our site since the front wheel was totally kaput.

We had time to do the short nature walk before leaving for our next destination. It was well laid out and signposted. The forest and river trail was beautiful.

We'd definitely go back and stay here again.

This is a great state park. Wonderful sandy beach with a great beach house with restrooms, concessions, classroom space, and a huge fireplace in the big lobby seating area. Great hiking up to the top of Elmore Mountain and lower loop trails as well. The camping sites are nice, too.

This place is so well taken care of.  The locals are wonderful and nice.  There's a great corner store that has all the essentials and even some surprises.  The lake, roads and trails are well cared for.  And the view...it's pretty amazing.  If you're renting a house, be sure to get one facing the mountain.  And with a hot tub if you can.  Nothing better than jumping out into the cold water then back again.  The park itself has a great hiking trail to firehouse tower.  If you're afraid of heights, it's a touch scary but totally worth it at the top.  The beach is a great place for kids and family.
Need a quiet place to relax and take a dip in a lake, this is it!!
Great hike. Amazing views.  Fire tower still open

name: Warren Falls
reviews: Without a doubt, one of Vermont's finest plunge pools. Part of the Green Mountain National Forest, the emerald green water is breath taking. Swimming here takes top priority as well as hiking and picnicking. Can get busy at times, just find yourself a pool to take a dip. Come on in the water's fine. Everyone's friendly, remember to take your garbage with you. Incredible waterfalls. Totally beautiful while visiting during autumn and fall foliage. Kindly click like if you find this post and my photos helpful.
Gorgeous place. My favorite swimming hole so far...The cliff jumps were super fun! Highly recommended

Beautiful! Went during the summer and looked for random spots to adventure to. This place is popular, some parking along the road, short 2 or minute hike in, and the water is beautiful! It is cold! Beware!
This spot is beautiful! My wife and I really enjoyed just soaking it in and enjoying the sound of the water. Makes a great break when driving the 100.

One of the best parks i ever visited, the shear size and amount of waterfalls is incredible. Plenty of deep water holes to jump in and swim, with natural rock slides to water slide down too. Great place to take a dip and swim in the spring water! Highly recommend visting warren falls you will not be disappointed! Such an amazing place!

name: Fairbanks Museum & Planetarium
address: 1302 Main St, St Johnsbury, VT 05819, USA
reviews: A fairly small, but wonderfully eclectic museum in a historic building. They've retained much of the buildings original features, making the architecture just as fascinating as the exhibits. The planetarium is newly remodeled and very interesting. Something for everyone, a bit of this and a bit of that. Staff is enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. They take obvious pride in their museum.

This place is gorgeous. From the extensive collection of taxidermy, to the incredible architecture, to the fun and unexpected planetarium show, the Fairbanks is a gem. We went once and it surely wasn’t enough, can’t wait to go back and bring visitors with us. My toddler was a little antsy, but between the animals and the science area, my kid had a great time.

A MUST visit. Great place to take the kids. Lots of interactive displays to entertain them for hours. The pieces in the original museum were very interesting. The highlight of the visit was the planetarium. The presentation was very compelling and the presenter was very enthusiastic and passionate.
Visiting is a must when in the area. The staff was very friendly and happily willing to answer any question. Very cool and amazing collection!

Natural history at its best showcasing a wide variety of specimens in well light up displays. With prices so low I couldn't believe my eyes seeing the breadth of the collection and the fact that they are so well maintained. Touring the museum took so much time I couldn't get to see the planetarium.

name: Huntington Gorge
reviews: Great chill places at the top of the Gorge with spots to sit in the pools ..
Magnificent spot to contemplate on the force of water and the beauty of nature.

We come here a lot to just chill. It's really pretty, usually nobody is there, and there's a small trail to walk on. Use caution, it's not a safe place. I wouldn't bring children here, careful with dogs, and wear good shoes if you plan on the trail!
Don't let the small scale fool you - the Gorge is as gorgeous and breathtaking as it is dangerous and capable of taking lives. Use caution and enjoy!

I grew up very nearby to the gorge. My friends and I swam there ALL THE TIME, because it is such a beautiful local treasure. If you're into 10-30' cliff jumps, the gorge has got some 'daring' options. Water is super clear, and very refreshing. 

Upper and lower gorge is recommended for kids and inexperienced swimmers. The risk of undercurrents is almost nonexistent. 

The heart of the gorge is the danger zone. 

 This place is not for everyone. You need to be hyper aware of water level, and monitor currents as you swim around. I've seen someone drown here. From what I remember, someone has died here almost every summer.

That being said, in my hundreds of times swimming in all areas of the gorge, I have never experienced a stronger current than I could handle.

Be smart, all will be well

name: Knight's Spider Web Farm & Cabinet Store
address: 124 Spider Web Farm Rd, Williamstown, VT 05679, USA
reviews: Oh my gosh!  I loved this little roadside detour.  We watched a web be be harvested right in front of our eyes.  Fascinating!

A friend told me about the spider farm when I was driving through Vermont and decided to make an impromptu stop. I am so glad I did! The guy who owns it is in his 80s I think. His son helps him with the "farm." The spider farm was featured in Obscura — a book and a magazine. 

They feature many different size webs for sale so you will be sure to find something in your price budget. And he told me how they started to make inexpensive wooden items for families with children :-)

In an adjacent barn, they have windowless panes hanging where the spiders 🕷 build webs. They spray the web with paint and then pass a board through thus capturing the web as art. The spiders are also hanging out in the shop which is pretty cool. So don't jump too high if you see one. Haha!

Him and his wife have been doing this for 40+ years. He was a sailor back in the day and he showed me a bunch of rad tattoos that were over 50 years old. 

I was thrilled to get a piece of spider web art from the farm!

The owner gave us a very informative and interesting tour (plus she was very charming). There is a very impressive collection of wonderfully preserved spider web masterpieces! It was inspiring to see someone's clear passion and dedication to something they love. PLUS - This HAS to be the world's only Spider Web Farm... How cool is that?!
Awesome spot to visit. Unique, for sure. Ignore the bad review. Realize, spiders aren't always active and enjoy the experience.
Super cool!!! Neat way to preserve nature!!!

name: Cochran's Ski Area
reviews:
What an amazing family run ski area!!! I cannot say enough about the customer service we received AFTER skiing at Cochran's. After a race, our daughter left her jacket and pants out by the deck. Marilyn found them and put them in a safe place. 
She followed up with lost and found the next day, tracked us down, and even delivered the items to us an hour and a half away WITH a wonderful story to tell our daughter about one of her racing experiences. Some day our daughter will be sure to pay this forward. 
Small ski hills are hard to find. Customer service like this is nearly impossible. Thank you Marilyn!!!! We will definitely be back to make some turns when we are in the area.
Steve
Best place for kids to learn to ski.
Went in the fall for a wedding. There were tons of cars there for mountain biking. Looked great but I didn’t bike and it wasn’t ski season. Beautiful spot. The building is a bit older but very cool.

"Daddy, I want to win a gold medal like Barbara Ann." 30-year Cochran's skier here. Come with the right expectation. Cochran's is about kids first, racing second, and everything else third. If you want to tear up steep and deep woods, Cochran's 350' vertical drop isn't for you. But you won't find a cheaper place to ski, thanks largely to the outpouring of community support that Cochran's receives. If you are learning to ski, teaching others to ski, or just like hanging out with Olympians in a historic and convenient and affordable family-friendly environment, then Cochran's is definitely for you.
Great family skiing, they care about the area youth and want to see them learn the proper techniques so they may improve.

name: Birds of Vermont Museum
address: 900 Sherman Hollow Rd, Huntington, VT 05462, USA
reviews: Interesting. Some of the bird carvings aren't very realistic but give you a good idea of the coloring of the birds. Workshop was very interesting. Nice touch was there buttons at some bird carvings that played the sounds of the bird when pressed. Too hot to walk the trails the day I was there.
It's great if you like looking at hundreds of wood carvings of birds.

Had a fantastic time here back in August 2019. The bird carvings are incredible! Very very detailed. Lots of love birds to see in the area and nice trails to hike on all around the museum. It’s well worth the trip out!

Amazing! Part wildlife experience part art museum. This place is great for people who love birds and also for people who don't. The wooden carvings are intricate and well done and super interesting to look at. The bird calls were fun to go through and see which ones I could recognize. They also have hiking trails and extremely helpful staff who is attentive and patient. Loved it here.
This is a really special place, built by someone who loved it and it shows.

name: Northfield Falls Covered Bridge
address: Cox Brook Rd, Northfield, VT 05663, USA
reviews: Was on our way to Vermont when we saw this beautiful place calling us to admire the love around it. The fall Bridges with a canal running beneath it, surrounding covered in snow with ponies looking at you is all you need to be in love.

This is one of three Covered Bridges on the same road.  These bridges are still in use today and are in great shape. Easily accessable to capture many photos. Part of Vermont and American history. So happy Vermont takes care if them .
It’s a nice bridge, I would recommend visiting in the fall.
Historical bridges, water, and pleasant store.
Lovely old bridge, one lane still in use.  The Northfield Falls are near by.

name: Waterfront Park
reviews:
We were here for the new year's eve fireworks and bonfire and fire jugglers. It was a very memorable experience for us. We visited the aquarium and Skinny pancake nearby to finish off our night. 
The people of Burlington are very hospitable. 
The parking is very convenient.
Beautiful place. I'm excited to see what they have in the summer. The skateboard park is near and I cant wait to take my kids on the bike path near by!

My room, was standard. The view in my room of the harbor was beautiful!! The desk attendants as extremely helpful, professional and friendly as well as the valet staff. I felt very welcomed, however, room service and the restaurant was awful. There was a 2 hour wait each time, they forgot my meal when I was dining in the outdoor area. Took 1.5 hours. They did apologize and tried correct the problem. But b/c this was the third time, I gave up and decided I would not come back to the hotel. It’s convenient to the airport, I’m constantly traveling and wanted a permanent convenient location when I’m in the area but due to the extra long wait times three days straight, I will not return. Hopefully they’ve fixed their issues for the purposes of other guests.

Beautiful place to walk along the lakefront. Bernie Sanders organized the purchase of the land, insisting that the waterfront belonged to everyone, not just a few rich people, when he was mayor Burlington.
He was a social Democrat, and Burlington is economically healthier because of his socialism. Everyone wants to live here.

Gorgeous during fall. Lots of people taking walks or using the bike lanes near by. No bike traffic next to the lake. Burlington, Vermont is vibrant and simply beautiful during the long colorful Falls! Use the swings if you get there!

name: Shelburne Museum
reviews:
Visited yesterday: a couple of buildings are open during October-May. 

The highlight was an expert introduction to the American paintings in the Webb museum by Karen, who was working there. She was incredibly generous with her time and knowledge and we came away thrilled by the many insights she gave us. Thank you Karen!

The photographic exhibit was also powerful and  captivating and altogether, the visit which took us 2 hours, was well worth the $10 admission.

Hope to be back some day...
Wonderful museum, huge campus. lots of different interests and subject matters to keep anyone in the family entertained. What a jewel for Burlington!
Perfect place to visit with the whole family. Beautiful, historic, knowledgeable staff that enhance the experience as you walk through each exhibit. Can’t recommend the Museum enough.

I loved that you were able to experience history from all over the state of VT in one location. We spent the whole day walking around outside, in and out these educational structures. The building where you buy your ticket, is also a store. I bought a beautiful fleece walking coat and a scarf while there. It is worth the time to browse through for gift ideas or for yourself! Be sure to check their hours of operation, since the actual historical structures are closed during the winter.
Outstanding compound of buildings and galleries containing fine and folk art with beautiful view of Lake Champlain. Amazing.

name: Mt. Philo State Park
address: 5425 Mt Philo Rd, Charlotte, VT 05445, USA
reviews: Lovely views. Nice place to come for a short hike on a paved path. Shallow incline, won't take most people more than an hour to get up and down it (unless you picnic at the top). Philo gets pretty crowded in the spring and summer, but it's pretty vacant in the winter months. Great for older, smaller, or less in shape dogs!

A lovely spot for a hike or a picnic. Many awesome vistas and photo ops. Camping here looks nice also. Some great facilities for larger groups and gatherings. A lovely and unspoiled forest and historic artifacts are there to be seen. This is Vermont's first State Park and has been enjoyed by many generations.

On Christmas day my buddy and I went for a hike up Mt. Philo. It was fun and beautiful and I was so surprised at the amount of ppl who came to hike. A wonderful day, beautiful views. I'll be spending more time there in 2020

Took a bag lunch to summit. Enjoyed glorious fall colors from picnic table. Wonderful! Lots of people walking dogs, even passed a group of home-schooled kids w/ parents. Hiking trails in the woods. A few campsites available. Adult day pass $4/person.

We weren't quite prepared for the ice and snow but the views were worth it when we made it to the summit. Guessing it would be much easier climb on a dry path or with spikes. Worth the drive to check off 'hike' from our Vermont weekend bingo card.

name: Great Vermont Corn Maze
reviews: Fun family experience. This was one of the best mazes we have went through. The kids were excited to ring the completion bell. There is also plenty to do when the maze is done. We would go back again when visiting Vermont.

This is definitely a great activity in a scenic area (especially if you’re lucky to visit on a mild autumn day). It’ll take quite some time to complete, so those with children may want to reconsider this depending on your respective children’s tolerance levels. The staff members are friendly and helpful. 

(BTW: A relatively short span of the road(s) leading to the maze is quite rough & bumpy so please drive slowly & carefully.)

It took us 4 hours to get out and we were frustrated by the end, but I guess that’s partly due to the fact that it’s a true “maze” - no map, just trial and error.... and it’s massive! Just when you’ve spend 90 minutes and think you’ve been everywhere, you realize you’ve only touched probably 10% of it. It was very satisfying to finally complete it.

SO MUCH FUN! The maze took us about 2 hours, with some hints, the property was great, clean, great production value, well worth the ticket price! All ages fun and a GREAT day with friends! We even volunteered a week later at Dean North and we can't wait for next year!
This is the one thing that we always plan to do every year as a family. It never disappoints. Plan on spending the whole day and come prepared with hiking gear and a sense of humor!

name: Quechee Balloon Rides
address: 1 Village Green Quechee Vermont, Box 1010, Quechee, VT 05059, USA
reviews: What a great experience! Chris was knowledgeable, competent, and friendly, and we felt like we were in good, safe hands.  His mom and friend, Chris, rounded out the team as chasers and did a marvelous job.  The ride was incredible on a beautiful day-- I highly recommend if you're in the area and have never ballooned!

What an experience.  Chris and his family made this adventure all, and more, than what we thought it would be.  If you have never taken a hot air balloon ride then this is the one to take.  Highly highly recommend

Chris is amazing at what he does. I contacted him to help me create the perfect proposal and he was extremely helpful throughout the entire process. He and his family did a fantastic job of making the moment perfect and they got us tons of pictures to remember the morning! It is clear he really loves what he does and he works hard to make sure his passengers have a great experience. Highly recommend!

From the moment my husband contacted Chris and even after we left, the level of professionalism gave us the highest level of comfort. I am afraid of heights and at no point in time I felt the need to worry. The most important thing for Chris is the experience and safety of his passengers. The sights were outstanding, the ride was a calming experience, and the mimosa and delicious pumpkin bread (prepared by his mom) upon arrival were a wonderful surprise. I would do it again and again.

If you want an adventure, take a flight with us.  You will never forget it.  Should you have any questions please give us a call and we will be happy to go over everything and any special arrangements you may have.  Happy flying.

name: Kettle Pond State Park
reviews: Great overnight camping options on the remote sites. Short, but rocky/muddy walk along the lake shore. No mosquitoes this time of the year!
Total peace and serenity love it here!

A little water at the beginning but we were able to get around it and have a nice walk around the pond. Markings are terrible and you just pop out at some random lean too sites with  o si eage for an exit. All and all was a good time
Great place to take a #winterhike with the pups
Breathtaking views of the lake in the fall.

name: Bristol Falls a.k.a. Bartlett Falls
reviews: Beautiful place! I've been visiting these falls ever since I was a baby. I have yet to be disappointed. This particular visit was different from any other trip. Some organization was holding a kayaking competition. It was absolutely fascinating watching the kayakers maneuver the main falls. It was definitely a day to remember.

It's absolutely beautiful, but unfortunately lots of dirty needles found in the area. 😭 I brought my kids and came back to a broken window and stolen items, after our first and last visit. The actual spot is beautiful, however the jerks that hang out there make it a *@#t hole instead of a water hole!
Nice views just off the main road

Clear, clean water, and a beautiful waterfall. There are areas of calm, shallow water - perfect for young'ns, and deep pools with high rocks that are perfect for jumping - for those looking for an adrenaline rush. I travel an hour to come here, and it's worth it every time.

A chill way to spend a sultry summer afternoon! Cool rocks, refreshing stream water, very Vermont. This place is popular with local and tourists alike - we send our adventurous happy chill guests there all the time June-September. Be forewarned: there are no lifeguards or any such nonsense. You are responsible for your own safety. The way it should be.

name: Montshire Museum of Science
reviews: New exhibit opened today! It is very thoughtful designed for the preschooler set. Safe, attractive and, given the enthusiasm of a room full of toddlers, very interesting too. Comfortable seating for watching caregivers. Climbing and crawling structures, stacking blocks, various interesting ways to roll balls, a bucket on a pulley to fill and empty endlessly, a telescope, puppets, magnets.... We really enjoyed it. Then of course we went over and got covered in soap at the bubble exhibit, as always.

This is a great place for younger kids. Probably in the 8 to 10 range is the best.
Museum is large enough so the kids can really enjoy exploring but small enough that they don't need to be supervised 100% of the time. Parents don't have to tag along with their children they can take a seat at the base level on the provided benches and catch their breath while the kids have fun

I've been going here since I was a kid in the 90s. Now I take my kids here. They're always putting up new exhibits. Whether you're 5 or 25, there are things here to catch your interest for hours and teach you new things. Prices are reasonable and staff are friendly and helpful. I recommend this place.

An amazing place for kids and adults. The new Wonder Woods play area for young kids is great, and the rest of the museum is so much fun. Nature trails are fun to explore, and the water features outside are great on hot days.
Perfect place for kids! Fun and stimulating.  Better than Boston Children's museum for slightly older kids(my son is 8 and we found that Boston Children's Museum was a little too young for him.)

name: Vermont Ski and Snowboard Museum
address: 1 S Main St, Stowe, VT 05672, USA
reviews: Cool little place 5 dollar donation encourage d, but didn't seem to be required. About 20 minutes of stuff to look at. Definitely worth stopping in.
Great place to go with the Grandmother!
I recommended to everyone.
A must for all ski enthusiasts
Quaint but none the less very interesting. They have a wide range of antique ski gear/exhibits for being so small. There's a small gift shop, too.

name: Waitsfield Covered Bridge
reviews: Another must visit Vermont Covered Bridge. Known as the Great Eddy or Big Eddy Covered Bridge, is a wooden covered bridge that crosses the Mad River in Waitsfield, Vermont on Bridge Street. Built in 1833, it is one of Vermont's oldest covered bridges.

The covered bridge is a great swimming spot by the river that I’ve grown up coming to for over 15 years now. Great for kids and dogs alike. There are a few jumps into the river from the cement. One about 3 feet high, one about 10 feet high. Then you can also jump out of the widows of the catwalk on the other side of the bridge. Amazing spot 10/10.

It was beautiful and was accompanied by multiple very cool stores and food stops. Jumping off into the river from the side of the bridge seemed to be a rite of passage for the locals and was extremely fun the become a part of.
Historic bridge, easy to find, definitely worth driving by!

We enjoyed seeing & driving across many of these old bridges in VT.  We were in VT for 6 wks.  We never tired of seeing the countryside, the beautiful old homes & farms with their HUGE BARNS.  Many had been taken care of & then some HUGE ones were be repair & that was sad.

name: Vermont Teddy Bear
reviews:
Really disappointed.  

I ordered a Vermont Teddy Bear for my wife on 2/12 and paid extra for guaranteed Valentine's Day delivery.  I received a receipt along with a tracking number and Vermont Teddy Bear pulled the funds out of my account.

My wife never received the bear on Valentine's Day.  I contacted Vermont Teddy Bear support and this is precisely what they told me:

"Hello Jeff! Looking at this order, there doesn't appear any indication to me as to why the shipping would display "Canceled by Sender", but I do absolutely see that is the case, and the package did not go anywhere."

"We would be happy to issue a reshipment, if that's something you would still be interested in, and we can absolute have your shipping costs refunded. Would this still be going to the same recipient address that's listed in this order?

That's it.  That's all they did to correct the situation.  My response:

"It's not Valentine's Day anymore.  Please issue a refund. Really disappointed. I can't trust you again."

I absolutely do not recommend Vermont Teddy Bear.  If there was a way to give them zero stars I would.

Wonderful tour of the facility. Our entire group of adults and kids had a great time. The gift shop was well stocked and so was the snack bar. Restrooms were clean and big enough that there wasn't a line to use them on a busy holiday weekend. Overall really wonderful positive experience.

It took 50 minutes to get a hold of customer service (its valentines so that's not horrible) and the lady I spoke with was very kind and helpful. HOWEVER they lost my order and FOUR HUNDRED other orders on VALENTINES DAY. so now my surprise teddy to my S.O's office wont be delivered until 4 days AFTER valentines day...

Lastly if your calling customer service use option 3 and then 3, because option 3 and then 1 leads to a dead line after 6 minutes of waiting on hold.

A must stop during a trip to Burlington. Cute bear cutouts for photos just outside the factory building. The tour is informative and you get cute bear buttons as well as little fur bears to attach. The tour is short so it's great for little kids with short attention spans. They even get to hold bears during a part of the tour. The store was fun too, so many bears to choose from. I got a teddy bear 30 years ago on a family trip and it was so nice to bring the kids to get teddies of their own.

So disappointed.  I ordered on the morning of 2/11/20 and still haven't received a tracking number.  It was supposed to be delivered today (Valentine's Day)  which obviously it won't be.  So glad I paid for the upgraded shipping.  Worst of all if you try to call after 8 minutes the music stops and the phone seems to go dead.  I understand they are busy for the holiday but don't say it will be delivered by x day if you can't make sure it is going to be there.

name: Stillwater State Park
reviews: It's alright.. The only thing is they tell u 930 no noise and kids get told not to talk if they laughing. Water is amazing lean-to and rent sites are great.
Great state park with tons of hiking, motor and paddle boating, fishing and biking. There are some great tasks and it's very family friendly.
Quiet park. Wonderful stay and experience.
We rented a tandem kayak here and had a blast on the lake! Now that we got a chance to scope out the campsites, I would definitely stay here! So much room for activities!
Park of the year. Best lakeside camping anywhere.

name: Shelburne Farms
reviews: Shelburne Farms is a nonprofit education center for sustainability, 1,400 acres (570 ha) working farm, and National Historic Landmark on the shores of Lake Champlain in Shelburne, Vermont. The property is nationally significant as a well-preserved example of a Gilded Age 'ornamental farm', developed in the late 19th century with architecture by Robert Henderson Robertson and landscaping by Frederick Law Olmsted.

Shelburne Farms is magical. First of all, it's pretty cheap to get in. It's less than $10 per person to spend an entire day here. Once you get your ticket, you can walk to the farm or get transported by a tractor. Since the property is HUGE, I'd wait to be transported.

Once you're at the massive historic farm that looks more like a castle, you'll be entertained for hours. They have chickens, rabbits, cows, donkeys, horses, sheep...so many animals that you can pet. They have programming throughout the day. Our daughter loved the chicken egg hunting! 

There's a farm-to-table food truck there every day serving burgers, sandwiches, etc. 

In the back of the property is the inn, which is beautiful. 

There's a general store at the entrance/exit that sells jams, honey, and cheese. THE CHEESE! It is AMAZING! Eat all the free samples plus more.

This is a beautiful and outstanding working farm with so many programs going on.I took the cheese tour which showed us all the steps of making their famous cheeses, plus seeing the cows and babies and milking operation.I love how they are committed to sustainable humane clean agriculture and will now buy their products.
The farm barn is a beautiful incredible building!

Wonderful place to walk around, enjoy the relaxing time in the park, many events for kids with animals. Taking tracker(shuttle) was also great fun. Having drinks at shelburn farm watching the beautiful sunset was super cool. I appreciate my friends who took me here. We had such great time here.

Such a beautiful place... lots of open spaces and trails to walk. Plenty of great views and places to explore. If you are visiting Vermont, this is definitely something you want to schedule on your itinerary.

name: Smugglers Notch State Park Campground
reviews: This place is absolutely stunning. Plenty of trails to choose from with varying levels of difficulty. There are mountains and waterfalls all in one place. Can’t wait to go back!

Beautiful drive through the area on 108 with several hiking areas along the way and parking area/clean bathrooms at the top. If you're from out of town, the road gets very narrow... tractor trailers and camper drivers don't do it!

Friendly staff! Secluded camp sites with the sound of a Brook running nearby as you wonder off into a peaceful tranquil land of green. Many places to see within a 10 mile radius. Many short hikes. Many more long hikes.  The weather was perfect for hiking (70's) while my fiance and I were visiting. June 9-11. Little chilly at night (40's) but it was not to cold for us in a tent with a hefty sleeping bag. Overall had a very pleasant stay at this camp ground and would certainly return for another visit.

Don’t miss the drive from Stowe up to the Smugglers Notch State Park. 

It’s perfect for summer and a dream during fall. Most suitable for foliage viewing and leaf peeping!

Small, clean and comfortable campground. Just far enough outside of Stowe to be quiet and remote while not too far from the center to be inconvenient. Staff was friendly and helpful. This campground books up quickly, so reserve early.

name: Killington Ski Area
reviews:
Awesome place to ski! Fresh trails, delicious food, great staff, stuff for everyone in the family to do if they ski or not. For example they have a roller coaster, a pool, and much more for non skiers to do.
Fresh trails, delicious food, great staff, stuff for everyone in the family to do if they ski or not. For example they have a roller coaster, a pool, and much more for Family members that don’t ski. For skiers you have so many options of trails, any ski school lessons for old and young, and amazing chair lifts To keep you warm on the way up the mountain. It is my favorite ski place I’ve ever been in my life.

Skiing Killington in Vermont is the some of the best skiing I've ever experienced. The glades were the best I've ever skied. The downfall was how huge the mountain was (as crazy as that sounds) it was hard to become intimate with the mountain because it was so big. There were so many options, but it was hard to remember where specific glades were or where you were even on the mountain. It took us all 3 days to finally figure it out! Overall though no complaint the people were great, great snow, good lifts and the scanner makes lines a thing of the past. There were 2 great terrain parks while I was there, made by Woodward and Burton! My buddy was hoping they had their big park done when we went (mid January) but due to a warm winter they were just getting started on it. There were great options for all ski levels. Highly reccomend this place. I'm looking forward to comparing east coast mountains to west coast next year (hopefully). Stay tuned... Overall I give this ski mountain a 26/30 only because if you're not there for a couple days you will be lost (there are plenty of maps but you just end up not where you were expecting to be)

I’ve been skiing 3 times so far and I’ve only ever been here. Go big or go home, right? 🗻🎿 The mountain has trained me well, I’m already frequenting the blue square trails! 🟦 Absolutely love the life of this place, super friendly staff, killer mountain and loads of fun all around! It’s an amazing environment, we’ll be back next weekend for sure!

All the recent improvements have added to the skiing experience. Much safer and better for the beginner and intermediate skier. The construction of tunnels has changed the safety of all skiers. The long Great Eastern trail is great for beginners, intermediate and fun for more advanced skiers. The lodges offer excellent food and “reasonable “ prices. Efficiency at food services excellent. The new lifts have greatly improved the wait times. I truly believe the Killington experience is the best in the East! Jaykap

Visited for the first time this past weekend and had an amazing experience from the rental facilities, ski lessons, customer service, bar service, and more. The lift lines moved quickly and many of the slopes were well groomed even on the warmer days. 

Our group had beginner and intermediate skiiers and everyone could find a trail or slope to keep them challenged but not overwhelmed. The efficient shuttle system from the lodge to the hotel was also a huge plus.

At one point someone in our group left a bag in one of the gondolas and the staff were eager to help us recover the lost articles and ensure we felt taken care of.

Would definitely recommend a trip for anyone interested in a day or weekend on the slopes.

name: ECHO, Leahy Center for Lake Champlain
reviews:
Was interesting, but definitely  more geared to/ fun/more to do for toddlers. We are one adult and a 12 and 10 year old. Was finished in about an hour, and that was pushing it. So almost  $50 bucks to all get in was way waaaaaaay over priced for what you get. Should be 5-6 bucks a person, absolute MAX...Not 14 and 17!  And that doesn't even give you full access.  :(
You Would  better off going out to a movie and all get snacks and drinks for that price.... and would  last longer.  

The more I think about how much I spent the more peeved I feel... as  this only occupied us for an hour.  at least it supports the animals they keep, who seem responsibly cared for.

It's our local haunt. Present exhibit is butterflies. Very cool. Older kids are not going to find as much to do for repeat visits. But you've kids will love it again and again and again. Great place to go to get out in the winter. Break the cabin fever.

Great aquarium and marine science center. There are exhibits that work for a good range of ages (including adults). They have a small movie theater as well as seasonal exhibits. We were able to see the butterflies this time. The membership applies to multiple places throughout the US.

We visited this museum looking specifically for the butterfly seasonal exhibit and we got a lot more than we expected. Unbeknownst to me, this museum also has a specific focus on turtles as well, which are my wife's second favorite animal after butterflies(which she says are animals, don't blame me). What more is there to say about a museum? It was clean, informative, and fascinating with plenty of interactive exhibits to entertain even my adhd-addled brain. Certainly worth a visit if you find yourself able to make the trip

Nice educational tour to understand the wildlife of Lake Champlain and surrounding area. We spent about 2.5 hours there and were entertained most of the time. We saw an Eel feeding and played with all the interactive exhibits. It was nice to see a wide variety of marine and reptile life up close.
We would recommend ECHO as a stop for anyone coming to Burlington for more than a day. See my funny face with a Muskie.

name: Lake Champlain Chocolates Factory Store
reviews: Chocolate shop and factory. It's a quick stop. They do tours on the hour. The tours are a short lecture overlooking the factory floor. When we visited they did an ad hoc your for us as we were there on the half hour. You get samples at the end of the tour - delicious! You can buy "factory seconds" at a discount. Worth a quick stop.

The best place for chocolate lovers!! Their chocolate tastings allow you to test out a few flavors before making your final purchases. They have everything from chocolate bars to truffles to seasonal specialities and even a coffee bar in the back. The staff is very knowledgeable and nice. Mostly, I love that they are a B-Corp and really care about making a bigger impact!

Such a yummy place! The chocolates are amazing and there are so many options to choose from. The ice cream is delicious as well. Try the butter pecan, best I've ever had and I'm picky about my ice cream. Vermont cows and milk really make a difference!

So delicious. The tour was a video and watching the bakers through the glass, but still interesting and the host was really good about keeping my dairy allergen in mind. Go to the drink bar and get some drinking chocolate. One of the best cups I've ever had. There's a discounted section of "reject" chocolate with some good deals.
Chocolate tasting on Sundays.  Yummy!  The factory is closed on Sundays.  If you want to see them in action, don't go on Sunday.  If you do go on Sunday, they have chocolate tastings.  win-win 😁

name: Pinnacle Meadows, Stowe Land Trust
address: Pinnacle Heights Rd, Stowe, VT 05672, USA
reviews: Nice hike, steady climb, rock scrambling near the top.  Beautiful 360 degree views!!  Well worth the climb!
Mixed terrain with some rocky sections. Pure fun for youth but a bit more challenging for those of us not so young🥴.  Great views at the top. The two labs were special.
Awesome view! Steep climb.
Very cool hike, there were dogs at the top.
Quick beautiful hike.

name: Oakledge Park
reviews: Such a beautiful park, so many hidden and tucked away spots in the trees, to enjoy the beauty of lake Champlain. I like people alright, but sometimes a peaceful moment alone is good for the soul. Visit early morning to early afternoon, or late night. This special place can get quite bustling at times.

Wow, what a great park.  An older style playground that is still fun, with a new accessible playground being built.  Has a great bike trail, ledges for sunbathing, a beach, fields and courts, and a tree house?  Kids loved it.

I absolutely love this park. There is plenty of parking. Volleyball and tennis courts, easy access pavilions with bathrooms in the summer. A few grills to cook on, with plenty of beach space. It is one of the best sunset parks in the area. Not as busy and crazy as waterfront park while still having similar amenities. The only feedback I have is that I wish they cleared/plowed the bike path that goes through it during the winter time. If its winter, walk at your own risk the path gets incredibly icy.
One of my favorite parks. The Earth Clock has special meaning to my husband and I. We were engaged here. There is a small beach and trails around the area, and it's along the Burlington Bike.

Oakledge Park is the ultimate getaway, especially in the summertime. There are plenty of things to do in the park, like play on the swings, use the tennis or shuffle ball courts, or relax by the water along the rocky cliffs and take a quick dip. The summer sunsets here are perfect and the cooking/eating areas are well-kept. The perfect spot for anyone visiting Burlington!

name: Boyden Valley Winery & Spirits
reviews: Loved everything we tried here. There was a lot of variety (in wine varieties and other things such as cider), and Jamie was a personable and knowledgeable host. Also greatly enjoyed the well done cheese board and chocolate boards with a glass of wine on their patio.

My girlfriend and I visited Smuggler's Notch area this past weekend and stopped by at Boyden Valley Winery. 

We instantly liked the atmosphere and enjoyed the knowledgeable wine tasting with Tina. 

After that we sat on the patio and enjoyed each one of our favourite wines from this winery. We loved this place very much. Definitely worth a visit.
Great tour and tasting. Picturesque setting. Highly recommend.

Excellent vineyard with delicious dessert wines. It is always a place we take friends and family. The tasting is wonderful but I was personally disappointed the tasting fee wasn't waved after spending several hundred dollars purchasing 8 bottles of your product.

Just an excellent experience with a great variety of unique wines.  The Cranberry wine is quite unusual.  The staff is very friendly and the tour of the compact but modern facilities was very informative, especially for us engineer types.

name: Three Penny Taproom
reviews: The food is absolutely delicious. I’m vegetarian and ALWAYS struggle to find a good homemade veggie or black bean burger so I never get them. I ordered a black bean burger from TPT and it was the most scrumptious burger I’ve ever had! The fries are crispy and delicious and the variety of beer on tap is delightful. My partner got the pork sandwich and ate every bite. The waitress was kind and attentive. The atmosphere was home-y and relaxing. The prices are reasonable for the quality and quantity you get. It’s a bit far from where I live but I will definitely make the drive out there again to eat their food. Not a single complaint!

I came here after a long hike and had a delicious meal and beer here. I ordered the braised pork sandwich with fries and cheese. It was DELICIOUS! The pork had a nice flavor but the bun really made it a great taste; it was burned in a perfect way that created a smokiness for me that I enjoyed. The cheese fries were delicious and went well with the beer I had. Friendly service and a beautiful downtown area!

There are 24 craft beers on tap about 12 more in cans and bottles. Good selection of regional and popular craft beers. The food was decent, tried the poutine and enjoyed the flavor - it was a little bit on the salty end though. I prefer the wings with sauce already on them, but the chili flavor gave a positive bite at least. Friendly staff. Conveniently located in downtown Montpelier.

My boyfriend and I met here, everyone there is so friendly and I love that they keep their products local. Everyone is so nice that works there, we make it a point to come back at least every six months. Thanks guys!

Best bar food around, hands down!! They have a guy who is a Pickle freak and he does all the pickling for the joint, and let me say that I dont eat pickles, but tore them things up, plus they have pickled pumpkin. I order the Chicken Liver Mousse and I didn't know what it was,but it was freaking Aaamazing!!!!#@$@@#

name: Sugarbush Farm
address: 591 Sugarbush Farm Rd, Woodstock, VT 05091, USA
reviews: We’ve stopped at Sugarbush farm a couple times now and had a great experience every time. The people who work there are super friendly and very helpful. We’ve tasted a ton of cheese (all delicious!) and maple syrup (so interesting to taste how the syrup changes depending on when it’s collected). We just visited in the dead of winter and my three year old got to pet goats (extremely social) and see bunnies hopping around which she loved. Then we all ate a ton of cheese and left very happy with a three year cheddar and a gifted bag of ends. Can’t wait to go back again.

Such a cute place to stop! Off the beaten path but not too far out of the way. We sampled a bunch of fresh cheeses made at the farm, homemade maple syrup and then they had a little store section of other dips/jams/etc to sample. The cheese was so good we ended up purchasing some to take home. Really kind, cute place.

The cheese here is incredible!! Best cheese I've ever tasted!! Not only that, they also have a large tasting room full of other goodies to sample like syrups and jellies and honey and hot sauces!
