Along with an amazing gift shop! The drive out to the farm is beautiful and serene. This was my favorite stop in Vermont during our Fall East Coast road trip.
Loved our visit there! Got to learn about the manufacturing process of their delicious maple syrup. Wonderful staff - well worth taking the time to visit.
Awesome! So much VT in one spot. They really make the farm and maple sugaring an accessible experience. Also the cheese is fabulous.

name: Slaughterhouse Covered Bridge
reviews: Nice little parking space. Off the beaten path. + a bonus tire swing (in season)
Beautiful covered bridge right down the road from Norwich University.
My favourite covered bridge in the area
Beautiful setting with easy walk down for river view
I grew up here.

name: VINS Nature Center
reviews: Great outdoor adventure for kids and the family.  You enter and exit through the gift shop.  From there you head out on to trails with artwork and fun places to stop.  Along the way there are buildings that host presentations on wildlife.  Presenters are informative and fun - and kids like seeing wild life up close.  There are also areas where you can view birds and other animals.  There are bathrooms in buildings along the way.  Our favorite part is the canopy walk that goes up into the tops of trees.  The fencing had wire mesh over the boards, so I wasn't worried about my toddler going between slats.  😊 A fun day visit.  But there is enough to do that you could come back at many points and find something new each time.

We stopped here once in 2008 out of curiosity. Since then this is always one stop on our vacations. You will be in awe of not only the raptor but their staff is caring and full of info. Now every time we look to the sky we challenge each other on what type of raptor we are seeing. Please go bring the kids you won't be disappointed.

VINS provides an amazing experience for everybody at all ages.... The staff is very professional, friendly,  and knowledgeable. The aerial walk is simply a structural wonder and so much fun!!!! The cause for rehabilitating birds who have been injured and releasing them back to the wild if possible (or providing a home to birds who otherwise cannot live in the wild on their own) is a very admirable one and they do an amazing job! We highly recommend this place and we will be back yet again.....

Canopy sky walk is fantastic! I'm afraid of heights and I still loved it! The viewing area for the owls and raptors is wonderful as well and I can't wait to walk the trails next time. You can borrow snowshoes free of charge...great day out

This organization does great work for ornithological preservation and history.  The overall atmosphere and energy is very friendly. Intelligent. Clean. Well organized. The new skywalk is wonderful. A must visit place when you're in the area.

name: Marsh-Billings-Rockefeller National Historical Park
reviews: Nice farm and history. The place has staff around that informed you of the history and we're dressed for the period. Well kept and clean, great for a family outing. If you grew up around farms maybe not so interesting. Plenty to see though, would recommend on a nice weather day.

A walk back into Vermont history.  Displays how three successive families lived in the upper Connecticut River valley.  Tours conducted by the National Park Service so you can enjoy every detail of life lived over the past 200+years. Don't miss it.
Really cool farm in the middle of nowhere really. Lots of cool animals. My son loves the animals and petting them. If you’re around go here for sure.

Although historically interesting with beautiful architecture, this is a wonderful place to just get outdoors.  There are lots of tree covered carriage roads and hiking paths that weave the property.  We hiked up to the Pogue, which is a beautiful pond, especially this time of year (fall) with the foliage peeking through.  

Parking is convenient and plentiful across the street.  There is no entrance fee to the park, but if touring the buildings, there is a charge.  Reservations are suggested for the house tours.

There are lots of activities everyday, so check online for the schedule ahead of time.
This is a very cool national park, built on the idea of sustainable conservation. Definitely worth a visit!

name: Kismet
reviews:
There are places that are blah and there are places that are good... KISMET isn’t either of these!! I was here 3 weeks ago and haven’t been able to get this place off my mind. From the food and drinks to the service, it was beyond excellent. If I lived close I would be a regular here. 

Pictured is the Smoke on the Water 🍸, Bread Pudding, and Seared Beef.

Fantastic little restaurant near the State Capital. They unlocked the door to let us wait inside as it was about 2 degrees outside and we were a little earlier than expected which was greatly appreciated! Staff is very friendly and seemed to know about three quarters of the guests that arrived on a saturday morning. Nice casual and almost homey atmosphere. Food was excellent I had the sausage and biscuits which was enough that I couldn't even finish the whole thing, had an interesting flavor to it as well that made it stand out in a good way! Will definitely go back here when I am in the area and in need of a delicious meal that is locally sourced and very filling.

Brunch is excellent! They had such fun cocktails (like a ginger mimosa!), a variety menu and great service. It's a smaller restaurant, while we only had to wait maybe 20 minutes for a table at brunch I can imagine this place fills quick for dinner. I will definitely be back!
Absolutely perfect food and wine list, in a lovely atmosphere with beautiful humans! I can't wait to go back. 10/10 will dine again!!

Best Restaurant in Montpelier! Pork was exceptional, French onion pudding was great, fish was good, breakfast was exceptional. We went three times in our short stay! Go, enjoy, make reservations ahead of time though!

name: Sarducci's
reviews:
HOLY SMOKES IS THIS PLACE EVER GOOD!

Prices are very reasonable. $20 for one of their nicer meals and I promise you couldn't be more satisfied.

Go get some delicious Italian food. You won't regret it. 
I'm from the coast of Maine and even I think the seafood here is absolutely delicious!

If I had to judge this restaurant based on my last visit I probably would question myself on whether I would go back or not. I have been there three times before.  Twice for dinner with reservation, and my last time was for lunch. Both times for dinner were a great experience. I would recommend this place for dinner because it felt 100% different during the evening than it does in the daytime. My last visit was for lunch, we were sat on a table with the water view, our first 15 minutes after sitting down we were greeted once and barely payed attention to. The sun was beaming through the window so hard I couldn't see anything from the reflection off the table and silverware, I had to move seats and sit the opposite of my friend in order for us to not be blinded by the light. The soda I ordered was extremely flat it tasted like sugar water, when I told the waitress she got me a different soda and it still tasted the same. I was upset I even paid a couple dollars for that. The service at that time was very mediocre, the waitress wasn't very attentive or happy. The one thing that shocked me the most about this place and I'm not sure if it was the time of the day or because we were sitting by the window where we could see the silverware well, but they were not polished at all, in-fact they looked really gross and dirty. My friends spoon was very greasy as well. Overall I was not impressed with the cleanliness and the service that was received on my last visit, it changed how I feel about this restaraunt. The food was very tasty though every single time I have been there and I would still recommend this place for a nice evening time dinner.

Very good , very Italian food, very helpful service. Could use a few more vegan options but they've adaptable. We love it!  Not inexpensive but no more than any truly good VT restaurant. One of my favorites!

First, I was amazed at their gluten free sections, WOW!  My daughter has Celiac and going out to eat can be a bit scary, especially Italian food.  

The food was delicious!  The portions were perfect and the staff was outstanding.  I really can't think of a single thing that was fantastic about this place.
Solid choice with great menu options from salads, to pastas and pizza.  The mussels with tomato broth were excellent.  The Apple salad and Caesar were the perfect size for dinner.

name: Wilaiwan's Kitchen
reviews: Best Thai food I've ever eaten, hands down. Worth the visit every time and undoubtedly some of the most flavorful food on the East Coast. Stop in Montpelier and bring cash!
Awesome food. Get here early!

My wife who is from far away loves this food,way to hot for me,always crowded so I give 5 stars because what do I know,I think if there were lower levels of heat I would love it also.Great flavor just before my tongue went numb.

You won't find more authentic Thai food anywhere around here for miles. They only offer a few dishes each day, so you have to keep visiting to fully appreciate what they have to offer.

Oh, and cool art for sale too.

All the items in the menu tastes amazing! Love Khao soy, Massaman curry and Yam gai krob. You can check their Facebook page to see the menu. Every week menu changes. And they accept either cash or check

name: The Blue Stone - Montpelier
reviews: Great pizza. Nice crust and great selection of local brewed beers. Small space so you may have to wait especially on Fridays and Saturdays

Visited The Blue Stone for my first time tonight. Went with my wife and brother. A very nice atmosphere. The smaller dining area makes way for a comfortable and less crowded and noisy atmosphere of other local restaurants. Steph, our server, was very courteous! Always had a welcoming smile and was super attentive. It was only when we were leaving that we learned she was serving alone. Didn't notice, she was such a delight!!! Didn't come across stressed or overwhelmed once (I hope her manager reads this). The menu selection was huge! Lots of unique delicious choices. Will be frequenting this spot as one of our new favorites for sure!

Cozy pizza shop with a great street view. Seating is limited, but the pizza is delicious. We got the 10 inch namesake plus two sodas for $20, or you can also get a deal for $8.50 with two big slices and a soda. The bartender was friendly and attentive. Highly recommend!
Cozy bar, friendly staff, stellar draught selection and wicked tasty pizza.
It's a good place for a quick pizza

name: Pho Capital
reviews: This place is wonderful! I have been there a few times and always recommend it when I go to Montpelier. The food is delicious and very affordable. And the portions are just the right size. The place is small but cozy. The staff is very attentive. Definitely check the place out you won't be disappointed.
Vietnam never tasted so good.  Great flavored foods.  Dumplings were very good.  Soups are very tasty.  A very nice place to eat.

The food hit the spot! The pho in particular was perfect on the cold day of our visit. Service was friendly and reasonably speedy. The only issue was there was no customer service staff when we arrived so we didn't know if we could just grab a table or wait to be seated. We stood for about 5 minutes before someone emerged from the kitchen. A sign at the entrance would have been nice.

My husband and I have eaten great Vietnamese food in many parts of the world and we both would rank this restaurant very high. Not only is it very reasonable in its prices but the food is delicious. We ordered the lemongrass stir fry and the spring rolls and both were outstanding. We will come back again for sure. Also, the service was great and our waiter was so friendly and efficient..
I will refrain from using words to describe Pho Capital as this place is a must go and  don't be deceived by its location as great things are usually found in unexpected places.

name: Royal Orchid Restaurant
reviews:
The food is delicious.  I had the seaweed soup which was pretty good, although I personally like the tom yum better.  As for my entrèe, that was absolutely amazing.  Perfect level of spice, fresh and crisp veggies, the egg noodles had a perfect texture, and the chicken was of better than average quality.  

The service was where this place lacks a bit.  It was slow and there appeared to only be one waitress and one bartender, but several tables full of customers (so we figured the food must be good).  I personally work in the service industry and it seemed that this place may be a little understaffed, but the food was worth the wait and they definitely make sure it's done right before it gets sent out.

I know how it gets in the industry, so I gave them the benefit of the doubt and still left a decent tip.  I will be back and I will be recommending this place to my friends!
Clean food. Great taste. We arrived 4:30pm on Saturday. Seating filled by 5:15pm.

Amazing food. Outdoor seating available and they are pet friendly. They even brought a bowl of water for our dog and he enjoyed having lunch with us here. I will definitely recommend this place and will visit again. Bean vermicelli dish was out of the world
A nice surprise. Authentic Thai food in Montpelier. Food is well prepared the right way. I will definitely return when I'm in town again.
Delicious, flavorful Thai food. Happy to adapt for vegan and vegetarian.

name: Mad Taco
reviews: Cramped space, bench seating at shared tables. Loud, locally-hip crowd. Small bar with drink specials. Slow service, short staffed, but friendly and working hard... the food was pretty great. Cubano sandwich was fantastic! On house made bread. Everyone enjoyed their food, maybe slightly more for the wait, hunger being the best spice. No parking... local clue; park behind city hall and fire department ;) Easily visible from the street. I'd give 3.5 stars if possible... not quite 4. Not super keen on the dog in the restaurant. Pretty  sure that's not cool with code... Overall, the nonchalant attitude, rough presentation, and delicious eats make a reasonably authentic experience. Worth a visit for sure, just don't go if you're already hangry.

Loved it. Tasty tacos and fair in downtown Montpelier with a certain local feeling of deliberate attention to food prep. Deliberately devoid of fanciness but full of elbow to shoulder taco fans patiently waiting their turn to pay and enjoy. Follow the locals to this favorite destination for a New England serving of grub and beer you won't regret.
Good options. Meal looked a little small when it first came out but was surprisingly filling. Flavor was great. Would definitely come back.

This is an excellent place to get tacos in Montpelier. They have a wide selection of beer, including Heady Topper and Focal Banger from the Alchemist Brewery. They also have an assortment of about half a dozen hot sauces that are rated on a 1-10 scale. My favorite are the Kimchi Tacos with the Shallow Days hot sauce.
really delicious and fresh made tacos! bonus for draft beers and great service. small spot, basic with no frills counter service.

name: J Morgan's Steakhouse
reviews: Food is very good but prepare to wait a LONG time. Service was good as well. Food took just short of an hour. We ate a wide variety of menu items and they were all Very good. Ourselves and everyone around us waited a very long time to get our meals. I will return again because the food was good and see if they have gotten better and then raise my stars if so!

The steak burger was good, and I really like the fries that come with them. The decor was great and it was a nice atmosphere. The food was a little more expensive than I expected but still not too bad. The service left a little to be desired, but considering it was a holiday I won't really hold that against them. I would come back here to try more of the menu when I'm back in the area.

This place is so wonderful. Walking in and seeing the miniature trains going on tracks above the door and the bar area is so unique and brought me great joy. The whole restaurant has a beautiful layout and the tables are made to seat large parties. We had a group of 9 and the environments allows for great conversations. The staff was wonderful! I had the wagu and shrimp special and it was so good! Finished the meal off with a brownie sundae and an expresso. This is by far one of my favorite steak houses!

All of the food was fantastic, and the service was impeccable. 

The Caesar salad was one of the best I've ever had, they put the right amount of cheese on it, and it was completely chilled. The steaks were of course amazing, cooked perfectly. My rare was rare. 

And because it was our anniversary, they gave us a beautiful desert which was absolutely delicious.
Great brunches and big buffets. The hotel has antiquated rooms but my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and meal. Also the movie theater is 50'away!

name: Buddy's Famous
reviews: Great spot! Cheesesteak and cheeseburgers were very good! Fresh fries & awesome shakes! We will be back for sure!

What a great place to eat!! We stumbled upon this eatery while driving to NH.  What a find!  It was extra clean, courteous,  helpful staff.  The food was great! French fries were amazing!  The hamburgers were juicy and perfectly cooked.  There were many condiments for the food.
We haven't had milkshakes for a long time but got them here and we were very pleased!  

The prices were very reasonable, and we will definitely stop here another time.

Excellent food safety, careful preparation, order fulfillment and delivery. Tasty burgers that make me feel like I'm at home. It's not local, but what can you really ask for during the greater depression?
Delicious, Flavorful, Filling burgers. Great fair price for a lot of food. Excellent staff who are friendly and a clean inviting dining room. Buddy's is the spot!!

This was a gem of a find. Parking is not plentiful, so you may need to pay a meter like us, but it was worth it. The burgers, grilled chicken sandwich, and grilled cheese were great. The chicken strips were good, but I couldn't tell if they were fresh or store bought. The fries were fresh and relishes, and the tater tots were super crispy and delicious. We also had a variety of shakes from peanut butter cup to oreo to oreo with peppermint, and all were delicious.

name: Pho Thai Express
reviews: Enjoyed the food here. Very flavorful and filling. The man at the counter was friendly and helpful with suggestions. Dining area is kept clean and tidy. Highly recommended!

My family went to this restaurant yesterday October 21, it was horrible experienced we ever have encountered for Asian restaurant. The  MOST RUDEST PERSON EVER and he is the owner ( which you can see his photos on the wall inside that restaurant.

1) We entered My husband, our son and I... we went direct to the counter to checked the menu, but my husband was rushing to the restroom... immediately that man stopped my husband from going to the restroom in the rudest way.

2) He was rushing us ( our son and I ) to order which we were still thinking of what we feel like eating that moment. 

3) After we order the chi curry ( which he forced us to order in a quick decision )..... then he immediately asking us to pay it right away which I was still looking at the menu.

4) When my husband came out the restroom.... he said to us “ maybe we should just eat here instead in a car as it maybe messy to eat in that car! .... that man immediately said we should have told him right away as he already put in the container. We even say not to worry about changing into a plate we will just eat it direct from the container..... he was so extremely rude ..... we couldn’t stand his rudeness, so we decided to leave.

WE WILL NEVER EVER ORDER IN THAT RESTAURANT EVER AGAIN! 
THE FOOD IN NOT EVEN THAT GOOD.
Love their soups. I do them as take out. Never disappoints.
It was just ok. Not much options for pescitarians. The broth used for the pho was ok. Servings were big.
Food is great and the owner Sam is awesome. He always makes an effort to remember his repeat customers and is super friendly!

name: NECI on Main
reviews: Cutest dining room in Montpelier right now. Downstairs hidden gem. Craft beer, cider, cocktails made from scratch. Local spirits and great selection of whiskey and bourbon. Chef Adam Noe created menu.
The meal was great. The staff/students were very attentive and pleasant. They went above and beyond to ensure our large party (20+) was satisfied.
Hoity toity tasty food!
Unfortunately the restaurant is now closed!
Great food, very good wine selection, quiet, classy environment.  It is run by a culinary school, must try it.  And the pricing is reasonable.  Good value.

name: Positive Pie Inc.
reviews:
Great food, and awesome tap list. Prices vary: A slice and a switchback for ~$8 at the bar, but full specialty pizzas get expensive quickly. Lots of other great meal options on the menu too. 

The place for pizza in Montpelier

Tomato Sauce is Red,
Cheese is White,
Positive Pie Pizza, 
Is Outta Sight !!!!

The guy at Positive Pie in Montplier VT went out of his way to speak and introduce himself and offer a complimentary slice of pizza. OUTSTANDING HUMAN - OUTSTANDING GESTURE!!! In these weird times, it is people like this that hold our community as a whole together and offer light at the end of the tunnel.
Gratis!!
Heard tale of this pizza place since we moved here from Tennessee. Finally got the chance today and I was not disappointed! The white garlic sauce was amazing! Will go back here again.
Really great food and atmosphere, the staff is very friendly. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is for the prices, it's good but maybe not that good for the price.

First time visiting the Mont and this place looked welcoming to me, so I figured what the hell? Inevitably, it was a great choice because I was hungry! Also, having the Alchemist's flagships on hand may or may not have played a major role in this review...

name: Bagitos bagel and burrito cafe
reviews: Good food and service. Live music and beer too! Bagels could be chewier. Super confusing choice to serve bagels, sandwiches, tacos, burritos, and Indian food- maybe a more focused offering would be more successful? The restaurant is up for sale for $66k all in if you're interested. See attached pictures for full menu

The beauty of this place is the openness to other languages and musical traditions. Live traditional music from Ireland or Italy are some of the events that are presented. Perhaps a bit of cleanliness would make the place better. Also, there are crates at the entrance offering books for exchange. They only had newspapers. I just had a cup of tea at this place whose forte are bagels...

This place was really cool. I walked in on an early morning for a bagel and there was a folk violin group jamming out. Bought a bag of cinnamon bagel chips too. They were fairly good. The bagel itself(everything) was ultra fresh and good.
Great niche place with a relaxing vibe and interesting concept (bagels and burritos). Friendly staff and tasty burritos.
Very good bagels and cream cheese! Awesome coffee too. I love this place.

name: Wayside Restaurant, Bakery & Creamery
reviews: Took my friend down memory lane today. She used to take her Mom here every Mother's Day. Good eats - even took home a dozen rolls to enjoy. Good service. Good selection. Good prices.

A good ol' greasy spoon diner. Friendly staff and affordable pricing. Oh, and the donuts are amazing!! Things to know: Saturday and Sunday brunch times are very busy. Easy to seat 1to 4 people. If you have a party bigger than 4, expect to wait. Few tables for big parties. All in all, a great place!

This 102 year old restaurant was a treat to go to. Our waitress was very pleasant and accommodating. The food was good and came out in a reasonable time. We also tried Moxie for the first time and she brought us tasting cups for everyone at the table.

Always a good time at the Wayside!! This place opened in 1918 I believe if that tells you anything. The food is incredibly good comfort food at a more than fair price. There is a cool old Vermont feel and the staff is always great!! This is where the locals go.

You're safe if you stick with burgers or soup, easy items. I am sorry I ordered scallops. They were in a dish full of hot butter, no taste and rubbery. The coleslaw or whatever it was was swimming in bottled Italian dressing. The rolls were good. Will order something safer if I ever get stuck there again. Cannot believe how packed the place was, and always is. Shows how few good restaurants there are in that area.

name: The Hippie Chickpea
reviews: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Montpelier! We visit usually once a week, and everything is always perfect. The food is delicious, and the coffee and hot chocolate are incredible as well. Not only is everything delicious, it is consistently good. Some restaurants around here are very hit or miss, but we have never had a bad visit here. I can always trust I'll get a good meal when I come here. The owner is incredibly sweet as well. She is so kind and always smiling, and she gets to know her regular customers. Love this place! Check it out.

I visited Hippie Chickpea many times... I am glad they opened here in Montpelier. I am looking forward to eat new cuisines here from a long time! Their Gyro, hummus are amazing... I am extremely happy with the taste. Will definitely recommend

We enjoyed our falafel and breakfast taco mid afternoon during a relatively quiet time. Ingredients were fresh, the flavors wonderful, the amount of food was perfect, and the free, clear water was refreshing. All for $20. We'll certainly return for more!

Excellent addition to the Montpelier dining scene! The falafel small plate was spectacular and the dynamite mushrooms very good.  We also enjoyed two of the gyros; great pita and everything tasted so fresh! Friendly service and good prices. Highly recommend!

Stopped here for a quick takeout lunch and WOW! Super friendly service, and it was the best falafel sandwich I've had in VT! 
They know what they're doing.

name: China Star
reviews: Our group, made up mostly of teenagers on their way home after a competition and mentors, arrived at closing time. When the owner saw us, she re-opened and took our orders patiently and with care. The food was tasty and hot.

Good food and fast service.
If you are in the mood for Chinese takeout then this is not a bad option, especially with being in the middle of VT.
I know most people won't agree but Chinese food is comfort food to me, always reminds me of NYC.  
PS. NYC Chinese food is #1 in my opinion.

Nice “no frills” simple place like anywhere in Southeast Asia or Greater China!!  Nice Owners!!

Seems mostly a takeout joint. I come here to take/out dumplings and then we make a great soy-vinegar-chili sauce at home to go with a glass of wine (as they serve no beer or wine here). 

The food is quite decent and freshly prepared at each order!! The hot & sour soup is excellent and so is their shrimp with lobster sauce.
Fast, good and friendly. All the greatest things for a local restaurant.
Good food, freshly prepared and fast service

name: Langdon Street Tavern
reviews:
It’s open late, for Montpelier, and has a easy going vibe. The beer is cold, the music is easy, and the guys working here are cool. The patrons are locals, who all seem to know each other, it’s a nice place. 

I had this wild rendition of Chicken and Waffles. If you’re a Chicken and Waffles connoisseur, check it out.
Absolutely delicious food and their wings are amazing, make sure to order more than you get eat, their leftovers are still a treat the next day.
Great people and great food. Solid beer list, with regular updates. Definitely popular with the local crowd. They have food specials that keep us coming back. A hometown favorite!
They have the best sweet potato fries and chicken wings wow, awesome service. Valerie she is an amazing waitress!
Between my husband and I we had a burger and a fried chicken sandwich. Best fried chicken in Montpelier! Excellent fries and onion rings. Excellent service. Overall, very happy with our experience.

name: Bear Naked Growler
reviews: Very friendly service. My fiance and I decided to try the bar for the first time and we loved it. We had a stout beer called the Gunner's Daughter. It was not surprisingly strong and had a nice flavor. The pub food was air fried which is slightly healthier but delicious. We will be visiting here again!

The beer here was pretty good however the prices were extreme and the food was disappointing considering we had went for dinner and spend way more than it was worth. It was cool to see the growler stations, and if I remember correctly they accept all growlers even if it's not from them.  They had many on tap but I would of liked to see more local beers or even more house made brews
Great beer selection and very knowledgeable owner
Amazing hidden gem. Great selection of local brews. Perfect pub menu. Owner is wonderful. Knowledgeable, friendly, and a great Vermonter to chat with. Thank you!!
This place is awesome. Tons of great choices on tap, seats at tables or the bar, and a couple of really nice guys working there. Not much more you could want!

name: J morgans
reviews: We decided to get married at the hotel specifically because of how good the food is at J Morgans!  The atmosphere in the restaurant and bar is awesome too.  And the service has always been top notch. And they now validate for parking in the back lot, so now searching for on street parking!
Ambience was really good. Our waiter was friendly and the food was served well. Overall worth a visit

Called ahead and got a reservation for my birthday.. asked for a table off to the side, got a great table. O ordered the fillet mignon and my husband ordered a ribeye. Mine was perfect, Bob's was so over done that he sent it back. ( He never does that) ..I waited for his meal to come back, knowing it would take a bit. In the meantime he ordered another drink,it never came!! Finally he got his steak and I asked about his beer,and she finally got it.  Desert.. I paid for..not one thing was comp.  Definitely not happy .. always bragged about J. Morgan's..not sure if I will again. As my family goes there for Easter and mother's day!! Really disappointed.. it was a special occasion ( my birthday) .
 Waitress was great, tipped her over 20 percent,as it wasn't her fault!!😭

Good food but definitely not the J Morgans of old. Service was slow, Bread is now a menu item ($3), Salad is extra (even with a $46 steak), Menu is paired down compared to what it used to be and the seafood selection leaves something to be desired. Too bad really, our family, kids included, used to look forward to a nice dinner together here. Time to find a new spot I guess.  I will qualify that the food is still good but everything else has really changed for the worse.
Mouth watering food. Great for special moments in life or treat yourself daily.

name: Sweet Melissa's
reviews:
Edit!!
I've been a few times now and wow. Talk about a good time. Melissa runs a great joint with the community behind her! The live events are great! There is something for everyone if you keep up with what is going on and that is a lot!!
Keep it up Melissa! 
Sweet neighborhood dive. We would've stayed longer but the political vibe of the band Umlaut was very off putting and put a dent into our enjoyment.. If we want to go to a politically themed rally we could have done so elsewhere. But we came to enjoy ourselves to good music and we're looking forward to the drag show that was planned that night. Unfortunate that we felt the need to leave before the show.. We will be back another time for sure. We did meet Melissa, nice owner, she's got a good gig there...played a round of billiard as well.

Drinks are always good, they have games you can play there too along with pool. Everyone that works there is welcoming! We went one one of our first dates there, so every six months or so take a trip into town and we have to stop there!
Excellent service every time! Good beers on tap. Ger the stoner wings and feel happy
The food was excellent!!! The fish and chips was crisp and delicious!! The fried pickles too!! The music was good and the staff was friendly and attentive! Love this place!!

This place is very comfortable and casual. It's always been fun when I've been there. They have a sea shanty sing along night, live band karaoke on another night, other live bands, food deals, and enough drink variety for a small place. It can be packed at times, but friendly enough for that not to be a problem.

name: Bohemian Bakery
reviews: This a French style croissant bakery. To say the least it is amazing. Very friendly clean and welcoming. The croissants are so buttery and delicious.  There are other items which are equally tastie.  If you are in the area you have to stop by. There are places to sit inside and out. So buttery. Note that they close early.

The cutest little cafe in Montpelier! After driving four hours up to VT from Massachusetts, I stopped into Bohemian for a snack and a drink. Loved the atmosphere and the food was delicious! This would definitely be my usual haunt if I lived closer.
This place is amazing. I absolutely love their baked goods. I am so grateful to live so close!
Wow. Go. Go now! Superb pastries and delicious coffee.
Was working in the area for 9 weeks. My off days I came here for a bite and an Americano. Great, warm and friendly staff.

name: The Skinny Pancake
reviews: We had the breakfast monster and another crepe. In general, we really liked the vibe of the place and found the breakfast to be filling and delicious. It was a good amount of food and too overwhelming, while still very filling, and inspired us to consider making crepes at home in the future. Even though this is a chain, it did not feel like it.

Good food. It was my first wxperience with crepes as a dinner item. I was quite please.
 They are ready for people who sit on the patio with dogs. If you don't see a water dish, ask. They keep bowls around.

Food is very delicious. Portion size is excellent.  Prices are very reasonable. Service is friendly. Subtracting a star due to the slowness of prepping the orders. Ordered an add on 5 min after the group and it took at least a half hour to receive the extra items. I would recommend this place in a second but only if you are not in a rush!
Very tasty pancakes. Really love that they serve real maple syrup with them. Coffee is quite good. Charming little place.

I used to love Skinny Pancake.  I have been out of the area for three years and decided to visit my old haunt.  I ordered the Henrietta Crepe with seitan on a buckwheat crepe.  $11.  The crepe was cold, and the spinach was raw.  It should have been wilted.  And the salad was sparse, like three small leaves of lettuce.   I remember the salad while not large could be considered more than garnish and the crepes were warm and delicious.   Next time I am in town, I will go somewhere else.

name: Domino's Pizza
reviews: Really like the employees here. Consistent experience every time. My only complaint (all dominos locations) is that the pizzas are way overpriced if you call. I can call and order a pizza and it’s 2 times the price of the app for the exact pizza. I think they should have consistent pricing no matter how you order.
Forks but no knives? Sad face. Otherwise great food and service

I always use the app to order and whether I'm picking up or getting delivery, the wait is short, and my order is always right. Not to mention the employees are super attentive and nice. Thank you guys!

Definitely needed to review this place.  Just moved in from Boston and moved to a new apartment which I didn’t know the address to yet apparently  (I had made a mistake in address while ordering) and the delivery guy still had the pizza there before our three year old could even whine about how there was no pizza yet. When we received our order the delivery guy even after my mistake was uber friendly and courteous and welcomed me to the neighborhood.  To boot, it was the best pizza I’d ever had from a dominos the ones in Boston have notoriously bad pizza.  Cheap, friendly, quick and delicious.  What more could you ask of a pizza joint? 🍕
Dominos actually has decent pizza and if you do online ordering you cant go wrong because you can almost always get big discounts.  Last week my family and I got 4 pizzas half price!

name: Bagitos
reviews: This place has the best bagels
Had a good quesadilla, nice Irish live music. The whole place felt unclean, especially the tables, so I wouldn't come back.
Had a perfect bagel this morning. Will have to try a burrito sometime soon
Great place, lots of choices. Who doesn't like New York style begals with their Tex Mex food!?

name: Café Anna
reviews: It's a cute little Cafe, the entrance is from behind the college. Prices are reasonable. Ordered chicken salad sandwich, avocado toast which are good but the hot chocolate was not so good

Café Anna is a beautiful little cafe, with very friendly staff! I recently attended my first game night there (Tuesdays) and it was so much fun, I intend to go back as often as I can! Thank you to staff Jae and Autumn and to fellow guests for welcoming me and my partner. I intend to try out Craft night (Mondays) upcoming weeks as well. These events really fill a void of fun weekday evening activities in Montpelier, and I'm so excited that the new staff at Cafe Anna is bringing that here!

Reasonable prices and pretty good food!  The sandwich I got had some extremely salty lettuce.  Okay for me, but I imagine some people would find it too much.
I'd definitely come back.
Charming atmosphere, excellent sandwiches, and they're starting to do more evening/social events like game and craft nights.  It's quickly becoming one of my favorite spots!
Quick and yummy. Lovely atmosphere.

name: Panera Bread
reviews: New summer salads are wonderful!

I go in here two days a week while my little girl is at school.  Everyone of the staff is professional, friendly, kind, and know me at this point.  When I make a mistake it's never a problem.  I love going here and look forward to it every week.

You are mistaken. Yes l was parked near there cause it was the only parking spot l could find. But laws over at pizza hut having lunch with my friends. That's what you get for trying to follow me every where. Next time l.willpark my car at. Burger King and walk over to pizza hut. To have lunch with my friends. Just so you can say l visited. Burger King for lunch. I think l need to buy a different car so you wont know. Where l go to eat or shop. You know to much about where l go  already.  Where do you go to eat all the time. McDonalds or wear. Many thanks. Pamela.
Great food and friendly staff who always provide great recommendations.
I love this place, service is fast and efficient

name: Cornerstone Pub & Kitchen
address: 47 N Main St, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews: Nachos had very little cheese, almost no beans, salsa was low quality, chips were decent.  For $12 the nachos were not hearty at all.  Turkey club was pretty good but not meticulously assembled.  We ordered 2 and they were average at best. Good atmosphere.  Nice waitress. Food is a little random.
The local fine dining establishment that does very well because it's the only game in town.  Greasy and salty, but admittedly tasty.
Excellent service. Great bartender. The most delicious blue cheese burgers and the fries are yummy. Great atmosphere.

A hopping little place. We stopped by on a whim just passing through town. After a 15 minute wait we seated at a high top. Food was good, prices were reasonable. The waitress could have stopped by our table a little more often. It was busy that night, so I guess it can be expected. Overall, I would return. It was a good experience.
Great food, best mac & cheese I ever had, with maple bacon & fish & chips were good too. Very nice restaurant and staff was great too.

name: Asian Gourmet
address: 276 N Main St, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews:
Good sashimi & rolls. 
A little bit pricy for certain items, but well worth it.
Always good. When you eat there the service is always good. Fresh Sushi and good drinks. Not over priced at all. Highly recommend.

I made valentines reservations at 7pm and we waited for our table for 10 min. Now it's 7:50pm and no one brought us water or even took our order. Also the hostess broke a water glass on the floor and didn't clean it up and her and customers slipped and a customer wound up cleaning it up themselves.  Now we left at 7:50 after waiting and never even got our order taken.  I've been here before and I liked this place but now I don't know why it went so down hill with the service. Someone could have atleast told us sorry for the wait or stopped us while we left. It would take a lot of me to come back to this place. How unfortunate! I'm very upset! Ruined Valentine's Day! :(
Delicious. Fresh sushi.. Best I've had in a while. We went for a Christmas work dinner and it was great! Nice area in the back for parties and waitress was friendly.
Sushi are nice, sashimi are not super fresh it's more frozen fish, but some like salmon was fresh. But overall food was good and atmosphere too

name: Ladder 1 Grill
address: 8 S Main St, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews: My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch. We had the spinach and artichoke dip and burgers with fries. The food was hot and delicious.  Our waitress was very polite. We had a great lunch with a wonderful atmosphere.  It is worth the drive to this beautiful restaurant.

If a fancy Italian restaurant and a greasy pizza joint made love and had a baby, this would be it. I mean that in the best of ways.  We had the garlic bombs which were great and the marinara sauce that came with them was phenomenal, however they served us 7 of them. This type of thing bothers me so much because there's always one extra and it creates this awkward social situation at the table. Just give us 6 or 8.  Pizza was good, very traditional Italian inspired flavors and the dough was very good. Nothing to write home about but it was a good meal. It should be said that the atmosphere was awesome, really nice decor and the whole firehouse history is pretty cool.

Went here with a party of 9 last time. Not one complaint from the table. In fact I have been here several times with no complaints. The menu has everything you could imagine on it. The only problem I ever have when I go is what do I get this time?
Great fare at even better prices. The attractive woman who owns the place is so sweet and very gracious. I highly recommend trying this place!

Absolutely a must see for the firefighter. Ladder 1 grill is the best restaurant around, amazing food. Completely amazing how they turned a old fire station into a grill that has different items on the menu from firefighter around the area. Tons of firefighter pictures and tee shirts and more on display.

name: Si Aku Ramen
address: 237 N Main St, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews: First time going there tonight. It was delicious. The owner/one of the cooks (not sure which roll he had) came out and explained what the different dinners and specials were. All sounded good. And the one I picked was pretty darn amazing. Everyone who worked there were very pleasant!

Always delicious ramen. My go-to is the Spicy Korean Ramen and it is wonderful. Flavorful, fills you up, and fresh. The Singapore Curry Ramen is also good- typical a special on weekends. This restaurant adds great cuisine variety to Barre. Go support them!

This restaurant beats expectations and is a great place to stop. To my knowledge there isn't much like this around Barre, and I hope that works to their advantage. It's a small restaurant with not much seating, but it's worth stepping into. The owners are very friendly and willing to accommodate for vegan diets and allergens. They make you feel welcome and promote a great dining experience. If you're looking for a good bowl of ramen try this place and you're sure to like it.
Beautiful presentation, absolutely delicious food. I will definitely be eating here again.

Food is pretty good but service and hospitality is phenomenal. They are a family business run by a bunch of super nice guys. Offer you extra bowl with tonkatsu broth for sharing ramen, extra hot teas, and even free steamed dumplings as they cooked extra.

name: Basil's Pizzeria & Restaurant
address: 20 S Main St, Barre, VT 05641, USA
reviews:
If you happen to get your order right, congrats to you.  Simple order..substitute lettuce for onions on my gyro!  " oh I'm sorry sir, I'll try to do better next time"  well how does that make up for this time? "Well I could give you a couple dollars off your next order"  how about you give me my meal next time? "Well I cant do that without asking a manager" 

So like really, i need to tell you to talk to your manager to give me what I just asked for?  So I'll just post this for all to see!  I simply wanted lettuce instead of onions!  Oh!!!  And this is not medium cooked!!!!   Looks like it's time to get people who know the menu, And people that know how to cook!!!

Update:
Recalled after an unsuccessful first attempt wanting to speak directly to manager or owner.  Was able to do so and made the situation whole!  Thank you.

Good food. One of the few options for delivery in the area. Usually comes within half hr/45 mins. The Calzones are so big it’s like folding a large pizza in half over itself. The portions on a lot of items will leave you with some midnight snack leftovers. Definitely recommend giving this place a try!!
My family loves Basil's, we used to go to Vespas in Essex, but now they have been surpassed by the Basil's! Wooh!
I love their food. they do pizza right. I had a great lunch. great staff.
Good food, delivers, local, friendly staff

name: Julio's
reviews:
Arrived before a Sunday dinner "rush" and was met by welcoming staff. The menu was apparently new and the waitress couldn't answer a couple of questions about it but it wasn't a huge deal. What threw me off was the number of times a waitress went by and none of the cups on my table were getting refills. Flagging someone down for a water refill isn't common but I attribute that to a fairly young or new staff.

The food was exactly what I wanted! Crunchy tacos and burritos made to order. The tacos are surprisingly expensive. Three crunchy tacos are basically the same price as a fully loaded burrito that has five times the amount of food inside. The chocolate toffee mouse cake was delicious - but had a negligible amount of toffee.
Nice Mexican restaurant in a small town which surprised me. The food was great & the staff were pleasant. I would definitely go back if ever in the area again.
Everything was delicious. I highly recommend the tamale fritters. Big thanks to Nile for suggesting the summertime white sangria. Street tacos were perfect for lunch.

I’ve only been to Julio’s a handful of times, but every time has been a great experience! They play fun music, their food and margaritas are delicious, and I’m super impressed by their customer service!! I had Tabitha as a waitress tonight, and she is so attentive and fun. Highly recommend for amazing salsa and a fun night out!
Tasty food at a great price and a good selection!

name: House of Tang
reviews: This was without doubt the worst Chinese food I've ever had. In fact it was kind of impressive. I would recommend to lower your standards and humble yourself.
Always a fabulous experience!
Great service and even better food. A nice quiet atmosphere. You got the fish tanks to look at also.

Went on a weekend evening. Place was not that crowded but the buffet was virtually empty of food. New food would come out of the kitchen but at an extremely slow pace and in small batches. Honestly,  everything tasted off.  Final straw was having to wait for clean ice cream bowls for the kids. When they finally arrived, the ice cream machine was empty.  Feels like they are really struggling and cutting any and all corners to stay open.
Great food and service.
